name: Add-ADTEdgeExtension
synopsis: Adds an extension for Microsoft Edge using the ExtensionSettings policy.
description: This function adds an extension for Microsoft Edge using the ExtensionSettings policy: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-manage-extensions-ref-guide. This enables Edge Extensions to be installed and managed like applications, enabling extensions to be pushed to specific devices or users alongside existing GPO/Intune extension policies. This should not be used in conjunction with Edge Management Service which leverages the same registry key to configure Edge extensions.

parameters.name: ExtensionID
parameters.description: The ID of the extension to add.

parameters.name: InstallationMode
parameters.description: The installation mode of the extension. Allowed values: blocked, allowed, removed, force_installed, normal_installed.

parameters.name: MinimumVersionRequired
parameters.description: The minimum version of the extension required for installation.

parameters.name: UpdateUrl
parameters.description: The update URL of the extension. This is the URL where the extension will check for updates.

name: Add-ADTModuleCallback
synopsis: Adds a callback function to the nominated hooking point.
description: This function adds a specified callback function to the nominated hooking point.

parameters.name: Callback
parameters.description: The callback function to add to the nominated hooking point.

parameters.name: Hookpoint
parameters.description: Where you wish for the callback to be executed at. Valid hookpoints are: * OnInit (The callback is executed before the module is initialized) * OnStart (The callback is executed before the first deployment session is opened) * PreOpen (The callback is executed before a deployment session is opened) * PostOpen (The callback is executed after a deployment session is opened) * PreClose (The callback is executed before the deployment session is closed) * PostClose (The callback is executed after the deployment session is closed) * OnFinish (The callback is executed before the last deployment session is closed) * OnExit (The callback is executed after the last deployment session is closed) Each hook point supports multiple callbacks, each invoked in the order they're added. To see a list all the registered callbacks in order, use `Get-ADTModuleCallback`.

name: Block-ADTAppExecution
synopsis: Block the execution of an application(s).
description: This function is called when you pass the -BlockExecution parameter to the Stop-RunningApplications function. It does the following: 1) Makes a copy of this script in a temporary directory on the local machine. 2) Checks for an existing scheduled task from previous failed installation attempt where apps were blocked and if found, calls the Unblock-ADTAppExecution function to restore the original IFEO registry keys. This is to prevent the function from overriding the backup of the original IFEO options. 3) Creates a scheduled task to restore the IFEO registry key values in case the script is terminated uncleanly by calling `Unblock-ADTAppExecution` the local temporary copy of this module. 4) Modifies the "Image File Execution Options" registry key for the specified process(s) to call `Show-ADTInstallationPrompt` with the appropriate messaging via this module. 5) When the script is called with those parameters, it will display a custom message to the user to indicate that execution of the application has been blocked while the installation is in progress. The text of this message can be customized in the strings.psd1 file.

parameters.name: ProcessName
parameters.description: Name of the process or processes separated by commas.

parameters.name: WindowLocation
parameters.description: The location of the dialog on the screen.

name: Clear-ADTModuleCallback
synopsis: Clears the nominated hooking point of all callbacks.
description: This function clears the nominated hooking point of all callbacks.

parameters.name: Hookpoint
parameters.description: The callback hook point that you wish to clear. Valid hookpoints are: * OnInit (The callback is executed before the module is initialized) * OnStart (The callback is executed before the first deployment session is opened) * PreOpen (The callback is executed before a deployment session is opened) * PostOpen (The callback is executed after a deployment session is opened) * PreClose (The callback is executed before the deployment session is closed) * PostClose (The callback is executed after the deployment session is closed) * OnFinish (The callback is executed before the last deployment session is closed) * OnExit (The callback is executed after the last deployment session is closed) To see a list all the registered callbacks in order, use `Get-ADTModuleCallback`.

name: Close-ADTInstallationProgress
synopsis: Closes the dialog created by Show-ADTInstallationProgress.
description: Closes the dialog created by Show-ADTInstallationProgress. This function is called by the Close-ADTSession function to close a running instance of the progress dialog if found.

name: Close-ADTSession
synopsis: Closes the active ADT session.
description: The Close-ADTSession function closes the active ADT session, updates the session's exit code if provided, invokes all registered callbacks, and cleans up the session state. If this is the last session, it flags the module as uninitialized and exits the process with the last exit code.

parameters.name: ExitCode
parameters.description: The exit code to set for the session.

parameters.name: Force
parameters.description: Forcibly exits PowerShell upon closing of the final session.

parameters.name: NoShellExit
parameters.description: Doesn't exit PowerShell upon closing of the final session.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Returns the exit code of the session being closed.

name: Complete-ADTFunction
synopsis: Completes the execution of an ADT function.
description: The Complete-ADTFunction function finalizes the execution of an ADT function by writing a debug log message and restoring the original global verbosity if it was archived off.

parameters.name: Cmdlet
parameters.description: The PSCmdlet object representing the cmdlet being completed.

name: Convert-ADTRegistryPath
synopsis: Converts the specified registry key path to a format that is compatible with built-in PowerShell cmdlets.
description: Converts the specified registry key path to a format that is compatible with built-in PowerShell cmdlets. Converts registry key hives to their full paths. Example: HKLM is converted to "Microsoft.PowerShell.Core\Registry::HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE".

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: Path to the registry key to convert (can be a registry hive or fully qualified path)

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: The security identifier (SID) for a user. Specifying this parameter will convert a HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry key to the HKEY_USERS\$SID format. Specify this parameter from the Invoke-ADTAllUsersRegistryAction function to read/edit HKCU registry settings for all users on the system.

parameters.name: Wow6432Node
parameters.description: Specifies that the 32-bit registry view (Wow6432Node) should be used on a 64-bit system.

name: Convert-ADTValuesFromRemainingArguments
synopsis: Converts the collected values from a ValueFromRemainingArguments parameter value into a dictionary or PowerShell.exe command line arguments.
description: This function converts the collected values from a ValueFromRemainingArguments parameter value into a dictionary or PowerShell.exe command line arguments.

parameters.name: RemainingArguments
parameters.description: The collected values to enumerate and process into a dictionary.

name: Convert-ADTValueType
synopsis: Casts the provided value to the requested type without range errors.
description: This function uses C# code to cast the provided value to the requested type. This avoids errors from PowerShell when values exceed the casted value type's range.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: What to cast the value to.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: The value to convert.

name: ConvertTo-ADTNTAccountOrSID
synopsis: Convert between NT Account names and their security identifiers (SIDs).
description: Specify either the NT Account name or the SID and get the other. Can also convert well known sid types.

parameters.name: AccountName
parameters.description: The Windows NT Account name specified in <domain>\<username> format. Use fully qualified account names (e.g., <domain>\<username>) instead of isolated names (e.g, <username>) because they are unambiguous and provide better performance.

parameters.name: LdapUri
parameters.description: Allows specification of the LDAP URI to use, either `LDAP://` or `LDAPS://`.

parameters.name: LocalHost
parameters.description: Avoids a costly domain check when only converting local accounts.

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: The Windows NT Account SID.

parameters.name: WellKnownSIDName
parameters.description: Specify the Well Known SID name translate to the actual SID (e.g., LocalServiceSid). To get all well known SIDs available on system: [Enum]::GetNames([Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType])

parameters.name: WellKnownToNTAccount
parameters.description: Convert the Well Known SID to an NTAccount name.

name: Copy-ADTContentToCache
synopsis: Copies the toolkit content to a cache folder on the local machine and sets the $adtSession.DirFiles and $adtSession.DirSupportFiles directory to the cache path.
description: Copies the toolkit content to a cache folder on the local machine and sets the $adtSession.DirFiles and $adtSession.DirSupportFiles directory to the cache path. This function is useful in environments where an Endpoint Management solution does not provide a managed cache for source files, such as Intune. It is important to clean up the cache in the uninstall section for the current version and potentially also in the pre-installation section for previous versions.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: The path to the software cache folder.

name: Copy-ADTFile
synopsis: Copies files and directories from a source to a destination.
description: Copies files and directories from a source to a destination. This function supports recursive copying, overwriting existing files, and returning the copied items.

parameters.name: ContinueFileCopyOnError
parameters.description: Continue copying files if an error is encountered. This will continue the deployment script and will warn about files that failed to be copied.

parameters.name: Destination
parameters.description: Destination Path of the file to copy.

parameters.name: FileCopyMode
parameters.description: Select from 'Native' or 'Robocopy'. Default is configured in config.psd1. Note that Robocopy supports * in file names, but not folders, in source paths.

parameters.name: Flatten
parameters.description: Flattens the files into the root destination directory.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: Path of the file to copy. Multiple paths can be specified.

parameters.name: Recurse
parameters.description: Copy files in subdirectories.

parameters.name: RobocopyAdditionalParams
parameters.description: Append to the default Robocopy parameters.

parameters.name: RobocopyParams
parameters.description: Override the default Robocopy parameters.

name: Copy-ADTFileToUserProfiles
synopsis: Copy one or more items to each user profile on the system.
description: The Copy-ADTFileToUserProfiles function copies one or more items to each user profile on the system. It supports various options such as recursion, flattening files, and using Robocopy to overcome the 260 character limit.

parameters.name: BasePath
parameters.description: The base path to append the destination folder to.

parameters.name: ContinueFileCopyOnError
parameters.description: Continue copying files if an error is encountered. This will continue the deployment script and will warn about files that failed to be copied.

parameters.name: Destination
parameters.description: The path of the destination folder to append to the root of the user profile.

parameters.name: ExcludeDefaultUser
parameters.description: Exclude the Default User.

parameters.name: ExcludeNTAccount
parameters.description: Specify NT account names in Domain\Username format to exclude from the list of user profiles.

parameters.name: FileCopyMode
parameters.description: Select from 'Native' or 'Robocopy'. Default is configured in config.psd1. Note that Robocopy supports * in file names, but not folders, in source paths.

parameters.name: Flatten
parameters.description: Flattens the files into the root destination directory.

parameters.name: IncludeServiceProfiles
parameters.description: Include service profiles where NTAccount begins with NT SERVICE.

parameters.name: IncludeSystemProfiles
parameters.description: Include system profiles: SYSTEM, LOCAL SERVICE, NETWORK SERVICE.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: The path of the file or folder to copy.

parameters.name: Recurse
parameters.description: Copy files in subdirectories.

parameters.name: RobocopyAdditionalParams
parameters.description: Append to the default Robocopy parameters.

parameters.name: RobocopyParams
parameters.description: Override the default Robocopy parameters.

parameters.name: UserProfiles
parameters.description: Specifies one or more UserProfile objects to copy files into.

name: Disable-ADTTerminalServerInstallMode
synopsis: Changes the current Remote Desktop Session Host/Citrix server to user execute mode.
description: The Disable-ADTTerminalServerInstallMode function changes the current Remote Desktop Session Host/Citrix server to user execute mode. This is useful for ensuring that applications are installed in a way that is compatible with multi-user environments.

name: Dismount-ADTWimFile
synopsis: Dismounts a WIM file from the specified mount point.
description: The Dismount-ADTWimFile function dismounts a WIM file from the specified mount point and discards all changes. This function ensures that the specified path is a valid WIM mount point before attempting to dismount.

parameters.name: ImagePath
parameters.description: The path to the WIM file.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: The path to the WIM mount point.

name: Enable-ADTTerminalServerInstallMode
synopsis: Changes the current Remote Desktop Session Host/Citrix server to user install mode.
description: The Enable-ADTTerminalServerInstallMode function changes the current Remote Desktop Session Host/Citrix server to user install mode. This is useful for ensuring that applications are installed in a way that is compatible with multi-user environments.

name: Export-ADTEnvironmentTableToSessionState
synopsis: Exports the content of `Get-ADTEnvironmentTable` to the provided SessionState as variables.
description: This function exports the content of `Get-ADTEnvironmentTable` to the provided SessionState as variables.

parameters.name: SessionState
parameters.description: Defaults to $PSCmdlet.SessionState to get the caller's SessionState, so only required if you need to override this.

name: Get-ADTApplication
synopsis: Retrieves information about installed applications.
description: Retrieves information about installed applications by querying the registry. You can specify an application name, a product code, or both. Returns information about application publisher, name & version, product code, uninstall string, install source, location, date, and application architecture.

parameters.name: ApplicationType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of application to remove. Valid values are 'All', 'MSI', and 'EXE'. The default value is 'All'.

parameters.name: FilterScript
parameters.description: A script used to filter the results as they're processed.

parameters.name: IncludeUpdatesAndHotfixes
parameters.description: Include matches against updates and hotfixes in results.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the application to retrieve information for. Performs a contains match on the application display name by default.

parameters.name: NameMatch
parameters.description: Specifies the type of match to perform on the application name. Valid values are 'Contains', 'Exact', 'Wildcard', and 'Regex'. The default value is 'Contains'.

parameters.name: ProductCode
parameters.description: The product code of the application to retrieve information for.

name: Get-ADTBoundParametersAndDefaultValues
synopsis: Returns a hashtable with the output of $PSBoundParameters and default-valued parameters for the given InvocationInfo.
description: This function processes the provided InvocationInfo and combines the results of $PSBoundParameters and default-valued parameters via the InvocationInfo's ScriptBlock AST (Abstract Syntax Tree).

parameters.name: CommonParameters
parameters.description: Specifies whether PowerShell advanced function common parameters should be included.

parameters.name: Exclude
parameters.description: One or more parameter names to exclude from the results.

parameters.name: HelpMessage
parameters.description: The HelpMessage field to use as a filter against the Invocation's parameters.

parameters.name: Invocation
parameters.description: The script or function's InvocationInfo ($MyInvocation) to process.

parameters.name: ParameterSetName
parameters.description: The ParameterSetName to use as a filter against the Invocation's parameters.

name: Get-ADTCommandTable
synopsis: Returns PSAppDeployToolkit's safe command lookup table.
description: This function returns PSAppDeployToolkit's safe command lookup table, which can be used for command lookups within extending modules. Please note that PSAppDeployToolkit's safe command table only has commands in it that are used within this module, and not necessarily all commands offered by PowerShell and its built-in modules out of the box.

name: Get-ADTConfig
synopsis: Retrieves the configuration data for the ADT module.
description: The Get-ADTConfig function retrieves the configuration data for the ADT module. This function ensures that the ADT module has been initialized before attempting to retrieve the configuration data. If the module is not initialized, it throws an error.

name: Get-ADTDeferHistory
synopsis: Get the history of deferrals in the registry for the current application.
description: Get the history of deferrals in the registry for the current application.

name: Get-ADTEnvironment
synopsis: Retrieves the environment data for the ADT module. This function has been replaced by [Get-ADTEnvironmentTable]. Please migrate your scripts as this will be removed in PSAppDeployToolkit 4.2.0.
description: The Get-ADTEnvironment function retrieves the environment data for the ADT module. This function ensures that the ADT module has been initialized before attempting to retrieve the environment data. If the module is not initialized, it throws an error. This function has been replaced by [Get-ADTEnvironmentTable]. Please migrate your scripts as this will be removed in PSAppDeployToolkit 4.2.0.

name: Get-ADTEnvironmentTable
synopsis: Retrieves the environment data for the ADT module.
description: The Get-ADTEnvironmentTable function retrieves the environment data for the ADT module. This function ensures that the ADT module has been initialized before attempting to retrieve the environment data. If the module is not initialized, it throws an error.

name: Get-ADTEnvironmentVariable
synopsis: Gets the value of the specified environment variable.
description: This function gets the value of the specified environment variable.

parameters.name: Target
parameters.description: The target of the variable to get. This can be the machine, user, or process.

parameters.name: Variable
parameters.description: The variable to get.

name: Get-ADTExecutableInfo
synopsis: Retrieves information about any valid Windows PE executable.
description: This function retrieves information about any valid Windows PE executable, such as version, bitness, and other characteristics.

parameters.name: InputObject
parameters.description: A FileInfo object to retrieve executable info from. Available for pipelining.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: One or more literal executable paths to retrieve info from.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: One or more expandable executable paths to retrieve info from.

name: Get-ADTFileVersion
synopsis: Gets the version of the specified file.
description: The Get-ADTFileVersion function retrieves the version information of the specified file. By default, it returns the FileVersion, but it can also return the ProductVersion if the -ProductVersion switch is specified.

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: The path of the file.

parameters.name: ProductVersion
parameters.description: Switch that makes the command return the file's ProductVersion instead of its FileVersion.

name: Get-ADTFreeDiskSpace
synopsis: Retrieves the free disk space in MB on a particular drive (defaults to system drive).
description: The Get-ADTFreeDiskSpace function retrieves the free disk space in MB on a specified drive. If no drive is specified, it defaults to the system drive. This function is useful for monitoring disk space availability.

parameters.name: Drive
parameters.description: The drive to check free disk space on.

name: Get-ADTIniSection
synopsis: Parses an INI file and returns the specified section as an ordered hashtable of key value pairs.
description: Parses an INI file and returns the specified section as an ordered hashtable of key value pairs.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the INI file.

parameters.name: Section
parameters.description: Section within the INI file.

name: Get-ADTIniValue
synopsis: Parses an INI file and returns the value of the specified section and key.
description: The Get-ADTIniValue function parses an INI file and returns the value of the specified section and key.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the INI file.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: Key within the section of the INI file.

parameters.name: Section
parameters.description: Section within the INI file.

name: Get-ADTLoggedOnUser
synopsis: Retrieves session details for all local and RDP logged on users.
description: The Get-ADTLoggedOnUser function retrieves session details for all local and RDP logged on users using Win32 APIs. It provides information such as NTAccount, SID, UserName, DomainName, SessionId, SessionName, ConnectState, IsCurrentSession, IsConsoleSession, IsUserSession, IsActiveUserSession, IsRdpSession, IsLocalAdmin, LogonTime, IdleTime, DisconnectTime, ClientName, ClientProtocolType, ClientDirectory, and ClientBuildNumber.

name: Get-ADTModuleCallback
synopsis: Returns all callbacks from the nominated hooking point.
description: This function returns all callbacks from the nominated hooking point.

parameters.name: Hookpoint
parameters.description: The hook point to return the callbacks for. Valid hookpoints are: * OnInit (The callback is executed before the module is initialized) * OnStart (The callback is executed before the first deployment session is opened) * PreOpen (The callback is executed before a deployment session is opened) * PostOpen (The callback is executed after a deployment session is opened) * PreClose (The callback is executed before the deployment session is closed) * PostClose (The callback is executed after the deployment session is closed) * OnFinish (The callback is executed before the last deployment session is closed) * OnExit (The callback is executed after the last deployment session is closed)

name: Get-ADTMsiExitCodeMessage
synopsis: Get message for MSI exit code.
description: Get message for MSI exit code by reading it from msimsg.dll.

parameters.name: MsiExitCode
parameters.description: MSI exit code.

name: Get-ADTMsiTableProperty
synopsis: Get all of the properties from a Windows Installer database table or the Summary Information stream and return as a custom object.
description: Use the Windows Installer object to read all of the properties from a Windows Installer database table or the Summary Information stream.

parameters.name: GetSummaryInformation
parameters.description: Retrieves the Summary Information for the Windows Installer database. Summary Information property descriptions: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa372049(v=vs.85).aspx

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: The fully qualified path to an database file. Supports .msi and .msp files.

parameters.name: Table
parameters.description: The name of the the MSI table from which all of the properties must be retrieved.

parameters.name: TablePropertyNameColumnNum
parameters.description: Specify the table column number which contains the name of the properties.

parameters.name: TablePropertyValueColumnNum
parameters.description: Specify the table column number which contains the value of the properties.

parameters.name: TransformPath
parameters.description: The fully qualified path to a list of MST file(s) which should be applied to the MSI file.

name: Get-ADTObjectProperty
synopsis: Get a property from any object.
description: Get a property from any object.

parameters.name: ArgumentList
parameters.description: Argument to pass to the property being retrieved.

parameters.name: InputObject
parameters.description: Specifies an object which has properties that can be retrieved.

parameters.name: PropertyName
parameters.description: Specifies the name of a property to retrieve.

name: Get-ADTOperatingSystemInfo
synopsis: Gets information about the current computer's operating system.
description: Gets information about the current computer's operating system, such as name, version, edition, and other information.

name: Get-ADTPEFileArchitecture
synopsis: Determine if a PE file is a 32-bit or a 64-bit file.
description: Determine if a PE file is a 32-bit or a 64-bit file by examining the file's image file header. PE file extensions: .exe, .dll, .ocx, .drv, .sys, .scr, .efi, .cpl, .fon

parameters.name: InputObject
parameters.description: A FileInfo object to retrieve executable info from. Available for pipelining.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: One or more literal executable paths to retrieve info from.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Get the file object, attach a property indicating the file binary type, and write to pipeline.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: One or more expandable executable paths to retrieve info from.

name: Get-ADTPendingReboot
synopsis: Get the pending reboot status on a local computer.
description: Check WMI and the registry to determine if the system has a pending reboot operation from any of the following: - Component Based Servicing (Vista, Windows 2008) - Windows Update / Auto Update (XP, Windows 2003 / 2008) - SCCM 2012 Clients (DetermineIfRebootPending WMI method) - App-V Pending Tasks (global based Appv 5.0 SP2) - Pending File Rename Operations (XP, Windows 2003 / 2008)

name: Get-ADTPowerShellProcessPath
synopsis: Retrieves the path to the PowerShell executable.
description: The Get-ADTPowerShellProcessPath function returns the path to the PowerShell executable. It determines whether the current PowerShell session is running in Windows PowerShell or PowerShell Core and returns the appropriate executable path.

name: Get-ADTPresentationSettingsEnabledUsers
synopsis: Tests whether any users have presentation mode enabled on their device.
description: Tests whether any users have presentation mode enabled on their device. This can be enabled via the PC's Mobility Settings, or with PresentationSettings.exe.

name: Get-ADTRegistryKey
synopsis: Retrieves value names and value data for a specified registry key or optionally, a specific value.
description: Retrieves value names and value data for a specified registry key or optionally, a specific value. If the registry key does not exist or contain any values, the function will return $null by default. To test for existence of a registry key path, use built-in Test-Path cmdlet.

parameters.name: DoNotExpandEnvironmentNames
parameters.description: Return unexpanded REG_EXPAND_SZ values.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: Literal path of the registry key.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Value name to retrieve (optional).

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: Path of the registry key, wildcards permitted.

parameters.name: ReturnEmptyKeyIfExists
parameters.description: Return the registry key if it exists but it has no property/value pairs underneath it.

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: The security identifier (SID) for a user. Specifying this parameter will convert a HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry key to the HKEY_USERS\$SID format. Specify this parameter from the Invoke-ADTAllUsersRegistryAction function to read/edit HKCU registry settings for all users on the system.

parameters.name: Wow6432Node
parameters.description: Specify this switch to read the 32-bit registry (Wow6432Node) on 64-bit systems.

name: Get-ADTRunningProcesses
synopsis: Gets the processes that are running from a list of process objects.
description: Gets the processes that are running from a list of process objects.

parameters.name: ProcessObjects
parameters.description: One or more process objects to search for.

name: Get-ADTServiceStartMode
synopsis: Retrieves the startup mode of a specified service.
description: Retrieves the startup mode of a specified service. This function checks the service's start type and adjusts the result if the service is set to 'Automatic (Delayed Start)'.

parameters.name: Service
parameters.description: Specify the service object to retrieve the startup mode for.

name: Get-ADTSession
synopsis: Retrieves the most recent ADT session.
description: The Get-ADTSession function returns the most recent session from the ADT module data. If no sessions are found, it throws an error indicating that an ADT session should be opened using Open-ADTSession before calling this function.

name: Get-ADTShortcut
synopsis: Get information from a .lnk or .url type shortcut.
description: Get information from a .lnk or .url type shortcut. Returns a hashtable with details about the shortcut such as TargetPath, Arguments, Description, and more.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: Path to the shortcut to get information from.

name: Get-ADTStringTable
synopsis: Retrieves the string database from the ADT module.
description: The Get-ADTStringTable function returns the string database if it has been initialized. If the string database is not initialized, it throws an error indicating that Initialize-ADTModule should be called before using this function.

name: Get-ADTUniversalDate
synopsis: Returns the date/time for the local culture in a universal sortable date time pattern. This function has been deprecated and will be removed from PSAppDeployToolkit 4.2.0.
description: Converts the current datetime or a datetime string for the current culture into a universal sortable date time pattern, e.g. 2013-08-22 11:51:52Z.

parameters.name: DateTime
parameters.description: Specify the DateTime in the current culture.

name: Get-ADTUserNotificationState
synopsis: Gets the specified user's notification state.
description: This function gets the specified user's notification state.

name: Get-ADTUserProfiles
synopsis: Get the User Profile Path, User Account SID, and the User Account Name for all users that log onto the machine and also the Default User.
description: Get the User Profile Path, User Account SID, and the User Account Name for all users that log onto the machine and also the Default User (which does not log on). Please note that the NTAccount property may be empty for some user profiles but the SID and ProfilePath properties will always be populated.

parameters.name: ExcludeDefaultUser
parameters.description: Exclude the Default User.

parameters.name: ExcludeNTAccount
parameters.description: Specify NT account names in DOMAIN\username format to exclude from the list of user profiles.

parameters.name: FilterScript
parameters.description: Allows filtration of the returned result by any property in a UserProfile object.

parameters.name: IncludeIISAppPoolProfiles
parameters.description: Include IIS AppPool profiles. Excluded by default as they don't parse well.

parameters.name: IncludeServiceProfiles
parameters.description: Include service (NT SERVICE) profiles.

parameters.name: IncludeSystemProfiles
parameters.description: Include system profiles: SYSTEM, LOCAL SERVICE, NETWORK SERVICE.

parameters.name: LoadProfilePaths
parameters.description: Load additional profile paths for each user profile.

name: Get-ADTWindowTitle
synopsis: Search for an open window title and return details about the window.
description: Search for a window title. If window title searched for returns more than one result, then details for each window will be displayed. Returns the following properties for each window: - WindowTitle - WindowHandle - ParentProcess - ParentProcessMainWindowHandle - ParentProcessId Function does not work in SYSTEM context unless launched with "psexec.exe -s -i" to run it as an interactive process under the SYSTEM account.

parameters.name: ParentProcess
parameters.description: One or more process names of the application window to search for.

parameters.name: WindowHandle
parameters.description: One or more window handles of the application window to search for.

parameters.name: WindowTitle
parameters.description: One or more titles of the application window to search for using regex matching.

name: Initialize-ADTFunction
synopsis: Initializes the ADT function environment.
description: Initializes the ADT function environment by setting up necessary variables and logging function start details. It ensures that the function always stops on errors and handles verbose logging.

parameters.name: Cmdlet
parameters.description: The cmdlet that is being initialized.

parameters.name: SessionState
parameters.description: The session state of the cmdlet.

name: Initialize-ADTModule
synopsis: Initializes the ADT module by setting up necessary configurations and environment.
description: The Initialize-ADTModule function sets up the environment for the ADT module by initializing necessary variables, configurations, and string tables. It ensures that the module is not initialized while there is an active ADT session in progress. This function prepares the module for use by clearing callbacks, sessions, and setting up the environment table.

parameters.name: AdditionalEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: A dictionary of key/value pairs to inject into the generated environment table.

parameters.name: ScriptDirectory
parameters.description: An override directory to use for config and string loading.

name: Install-ADTMSUpdates
synopsis: Install all Microsoft Updates in a given directory. This function has been deprecated and will be removed from PSAppDeployToolkit 4.2.0.
description: Install all Microsoft Updates of type ".exe", ".msu", or ".msp" in a given directory (recursively search directory). The function will check if the update is already installed and skip it if it is. It handles older redistributables and different types of updates appropriately.

parameters.name: Directory
parameters.description: Directory containing the updates.

name: Install-ADTSCCMSoftwareUpdates
synopsis: Scans for outstanding SCCM updates to be installed and installs the pending updates.
description: Scans for outstanding SCCM updates to be installed and installs the pending updates. Only compatible with SCCM 2012 Client or higher. This function can take several minutes to run.

parameters.name: SoftwareUpdatesScanWaitInSeconds
parameters.description: The amount of time to wait in seconds for the software updates scan to complete.

parameters.name: WaitForPendingUpdatesTimeout
parameters.description: The amount of time to wait for missing and pending updates to install before exiting the function.

name: Invoke-ADTAllUsersRegistryAction
synopsis: Set current user registry settings for all current users and any new users in the future.
description: Set HKCU registry settings for all current and future users by loading their NTUSER.dat registry hive file, and making the modifications. This function will modify HKCU settings for all users even when executed under the SYSTEM account and can be used as an alternative to using ActiveSetup for registry settings. To ensure new users in the future get the registry edits, the Default User registry hive used to provision the registry for new users is modified. The advantage of using this function over ActiveSetup is that a user does not have to log off and log back on before the changes take effect.

parameters.name: ScriptBlock
parameters.description: Script block which contains HKCU registry actions to be run for all users on the system.

parameters.name: SkipUnloadedProfiles
parameters.description: Specifies that unloaded registry hives should be skipped and not be loaded by the function.

parameters.name: UserProfiles
parameters.description: Specify the user profiles to modify HKCU registry settings for. Default is all user profiles except for system profiles.

name: Invoke-ADTCommandWithRetries
synopsis: Drop-in replacement for any cmdlet/function where a retry is desirable due to transient issues.
description: This function invokes the specified cmdlet/function, accepting all of its parameters but retries an operation for the configured value before throwing.

parameters.name: Command
parameters.description: The name of the command to invoke.

parameters.name: MaximumElapsedTime
parameters.description: The maximum elapsed time allowed to passed while attempting retries. If the maximum elapsted time has passed and there are still attempts remaining they will be disgarded. If this parameter is supplied and the `-Retries` parameter isn't, this command will continue to retry the provided command until the time limit runs out.

parameters.name: Parameters
parameters.description: A 'ValueFromRemainingArguments' parameter to collect the parameters as would be passed to the provided Command. While values can be directly provided to this parameter, it's not designed to be explicitly called.

parameters.name: Retries
parameters.description: How many retries to perform before throwing.

parameters.name: SleepDuration
parameters.description: How long to sleep between retries.

parameters.name: SleepSeconds
parameters.description: This parameter is obsolete and will be removed in PSAppDeployToolkit 4.2.0. Please use `-SleepDuration` instead.

name: Invoke-ADTFunctionErrorHandler
synopsis: Handles errors within ADT functions by logging and optionally passing through the error.
description: This function handles errors within ADT functions by logging the error message and optionally passing through the error record. It recovers the true ErrorActionPreference set by the caller and sets it within the function. If a log message is provided, it appends the resolved error record to the log message. Depending on the ErrorActionPreference, it either throws a terminating error or writes a non-terminating error.

parameters.name: AdditionalResolveErrorProperties
parameters.description: If specified, a list of additional ErrorRecord properties to print during resolution.

parameters.name: Cmdlet
parameters.description: The cmdlet that is calling this function.

parameters.name: DisableErrorResolving
parameters.description: If specified, the function will not append the resolved error record to the log message.

parameters.name: ErrorRecord
parameters.description: The error record to handle.

parameters.name: LogMessage
parameters.description: The error message to write to the active ADTSession's log file.

parameters.name: ResolveErrorProperties
parameters.description: If specified, the specific ErrorRecord properties to print during resolution.

parameters.name: SessionState
parameters.description: The session state of the calling cmdlet.

parameters.name: Silent
parameters.description: If specified, doesn't write anything to the log and just handles the ErrorRecord itself.

name: Invoke-ADTObjectMethod
synopsis: Invoke method on any object.
description: Invoke method on any object with or without using named parameters.

parameters.name: ArgumentList
parameters.description: Argument to pass to the method being executed. Allows execution of method without specifying named parameters.

parameters.name: InputObject
parameters.description: Specifies an object which has methods that can be invoked.

parameters.name: MethodName
parameters.description: Specifies the name of a method to invoke.

parameters.name: Parameter
parameters.description: Argument to pass to the method being executed. Allows execution of method by using named parameters.

name: Invoke-ADTRegSvr32
synopsis: Register or unregister a DLL file.
description: Register or unregister a DLL file using regsvr32.exe. This function determines the bitness of the DLL file and uses the appropriate version of regsvr32.exe to perform the action. It supports both 32-bit and 64-bit DLL files on corresponding operating systems.

parameters.name: Action
parameters.description: Specify whether to register or unregister the DLL.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the DLL file.

name: Invoke-ADTSCCMTask
synopsis: Triggers SCCM to invoke the requested schedule task ID.
description: Triggers SCCM to invoke the requested schedule task ID. This function supports a variety of Schedule Id values as defined via https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/configmgr/develop/reference/core/clients/client-classes/triggerschedule-method-in-class-sms_client.

parameters.name: ScheduleId
parameters.description: Name of the Schedule Id to trigger.

name: Mount-ADTWimFile
synopsis: Mounts a WIM file to a specified directory.
description: Mounts a WIM file to a specified directory. The function supports mounting by image index or image name. It also provides options to forcefully remove existing directories and return the mounted image details.

parameters.name: Force
parameters.description: Forces the removal of the existing directory if it is not empty.

parameters.name: ImagePath
parameters.description: Path to the WIM file to be mounted.

parameters.name: Index
parameters.description: Index of the image within the WIM file to be mounted.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Name of the image within the WIM file to be mounted.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: If specified, the function will return the results from `Mount-WindowsImage`.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: Directory where the WIM file will be mounted. The directory either must not exist, or must be empty and not have a pre-existing WIM mounted.

name: New-ADTErrorRecord
synopsis: Creates a new ErrorRecord object.
description: This function creates a new ErrorRecord object with the specified exception, error category, and optional parameters. It allows for detailed error information to be captured and returned to the caller, who can then throw the error.

parameters.name: Activity
parameters.description: The activity that was being performed when the error occurred.

parameters.name: Category
parameters.description: The category of the error.

parameters.name: ErrorId
parameters.description: The identifier for the error. Default is 'NotSpecified'.

parameters.name: Exception
parameters.description: The exception object that caused the error.

parameters.name: Reason
parameters.description: The reason for the error.

parameters.name: RecommendedAction
parameters.description: The recommended action to resolve the error.

parameters.name: TargetName
parameters.description: The name of the target that the error is related to.

parameters.name: TargetObject
parameters.description: The target object that the error is related to.

parameters.name: TargetType
parameters.description: The type of the target that the error is related to.

name: New-ADTFolder
synopsis: Create a new folder.
description: Create a new folder if it does not exist. This function checks if the specified path already exists and creates the folder if it does not. It logs the creation process and handles any errors that may occur during the folder creation.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: Path to the new folder to create.

name: New-ADTMsiTransform
synopsis: Create a transform file for an MSI database.
description: Create a transform file for an MSI database and create/modify properties in the Properties table. This function allows you to specify an existing transform to apply before making changes and to define the path for the new transform file. If the new transform file already exists, it will be deleted before creating a new one.

parameters.name: ApplyTransformPath
parameters.description: Specify the path to a transform which should be applied to the MSI database before any new properties are created or modified.

parameters.name: MsiPath
parameters.description: Specify the path to an MSI file.

parameters.name: NewTransformPath
parameters.description: Specify the path where the new transform file with the desired properties will be created. If a transform file of the same name already exists, it will be deleted before a new one is created.

parameters.name: TransformProperties
parameters.description: Hashtable which contains calls to `Set-ADTMsiProperty` for configuring the desired properties which should be included in the new transform file. Example hashtable: `@{ ALLUSERS = 1 }`

name: New-ADTShortcut
synopsis: Creates a new .lnk or .url type shortcut.
description: Creates a new shortcut .lnk or .url file, with configurable options. This function allows you to specify various parameters such as the target path, arguments, icon location, description, working directory, window style, run as administrator, and hotkey.

parameters.name: Arguments
parameters.description: Arguments to be passed to the target path.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: Description of the shortcut.

parameters.name: Hotkey
parameters.description: Create a Hotkey to launch the shortcut, e.g. "CTRL+SHIFT+F".

parameters.name: IconIndex
parameters.description: The index of the icon. Executables, DLLs, ICO files with multiple icons need the icon index to be specified. This parameter is an Integer. The first index is 0.

parameters.name: IconLocation
parameters.description: Location of the icon used for the shortcut.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: Path to save the shortcut.

parameters.name: RunAsAdmin
parameters.description: Set shortcut to run program as administrator. This option will prompt user to elevate when executing shortcut.

parameters.name: TargetPath
parameters.description: Target path or URL that the shortcut launches.

parameters.name: WindowStyle
parameters.description: Windows style of the application. Options: Normal, Maximized, Minimized.

parameters.name: WorkingDirectory
parameters.description: Working Directory to be used for the target path.

name: New-ADTTemplate
synopsis: Creates a new folder containing a template front end and module folder, ready to customise.
description: Specify a destination path where a new folder will be created. You also have the option of creating a template for v3 compatibility mode.

parameters.name: Destination
parameters.description: Path where the new folder should be created. Default is the current working directory.

parameters.name: Force
parameters.description: If the destination folder already exists, this switch will force the creation of the new folder.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Name of the newly created folder. Default is PSAppDeployToolkit_Version.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Returns the newly created folder object.

parameters.name: Show
parameters.description: Opens the newly created folder in Windows Explorer.

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description: Defaults to 4 for the standard v4 template. Use 3 for the v3 compatibility mode template.

name: New-ADTValidateScriptErrorRecord
synopsis: Creates a new ErrorRecord for script validation errors.
description: This function creates a new ErrorRecord object for script validation errors. It takes the parameter name, provided value, exception message, and an optional inner exception to build a detailed error record. This helps in identifying and handling invalid parameter values in scripts.

parameters.name: ExceptionMessage
parameters.description: The message describing the validation error.

parameters.name: InnerException
parameters.description: An optional inner exception that provides more details about the validation error.

parameters.name: ParameterName
parameters.description: The name of the parameter that caused the validation error.

parameters.name: ProvidedValue
parameters.description: The value provided for the parameter that caused the validation error.

name: New-ADTZipFile
synopsis: Create a new zip archive or add content to an existing archive.
description: Create a new zip archive or add content to an existing archive by using PowerShell's Compress-Archive.

parameters.name: CompressionLevel
parameters.description: The level of compression to apply to the zip file.

parameters.name: DestinationPath
parameters.description: The file path for where the zip file should be created.

parameters.name: Force
parameters.description: Specifies whether an existing zip file should be overwritten.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: One or more literal paths to compress.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: One or more paths to compress. Supports wildcards.

parameters.name: RemoveSourceAfterArchiving
parameters.description: Remove the source path after successfully archiving the content.

parameters.name: Update
parameters.description: Specifies whether to update an existing zip file or not.

name: Open-ADTSession
synopsis: Opens a new ADT session.
description: This function initializes and opens a new ADT session with the specified parameters. It handles the setup of the session environment and processes any callbacks defined for the session. If the session fails to open, it handles the error and closes the session if necessary.

parameters.name: AppArch
parameters.description: Specifies the application architecture.

parameters.name: AppLang
parameters.description: Specifies the application language.

parameters.name: AppName
parameters.description: Specifies the application name.

parameters.name: AppProcessesToClose
parameters.description: Specifies one or more processes that require closing to ensure a successful deployment.

parameters.name: AppRebootExitCodes
parameters.description: Specifies the application reboot codes.

parameters.name: AppRevision
parameters.description: Specifies the application revision.

parameters.name: AppScriptAuthor
parameters.description: Specifies the application script author.

parameters.name: AppScriptDate
parameters.description: Specifies the application script date.

parameters.name: AppScriptVersion
parameters.description: Specifies the application script version.

parameters.name: AppSuccessExitCodes
parameters.description: Specifies the application exit codes.

parameters.name: AppVendor
parameters.description: Specifies the application vendor.

parameters.name: AppVersion
parameters.description: Specifies the application version.

parameters.name: DefaultMsiFile
parameters.description: Specifies the default MSI file.

parameters.name: DefaultMspFiles
parameters.description: Specifies the default MSP files.

parameters.name: DefaultMstFile
parameters.description: Specifies the default MST file.

parameters.name: DeployAppScriptFriendlyName
parameters.description: Specifies the friendly name of the deploy application script.

parameters.name: DeployAppScriptParameters
parameters.description: Specifies the parameters for the deploy application script.

parameters.name: DeployAppScriptVersion
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the deploy application script.

parameters.name: DeploymentType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of deployment: Install, Uninstall, or Repair.

parameters.name: DeployMode
parameters.description: Specifies the deployment mode: Interactive, NonInteractive, or Silent.

parameters.name: DirFiles
parameters.description: Specifies the override path to Files.

parameters.name: DirSupportFiles
parameters.description: Specifies the override path to SupportFiles.

parameters.name: DisableDefaultMsiProcessList
parameters.description: Specifies that the zero-config MSI code should not gather process names from the MSI file.

parameters.name: DisableLogging
parameters.description: Disables logging for the session.

parameters.name: ForceMsiDetection
parameters.description: Specifies that MSI files should be detected and parsed during session initialization, irrespective of whether any App values are provided.

parameters.name: ForceWimDetection
parameters.description: Specifies that WIM files should be detected and mounted during session initialization, irrespective of whether any App values are provided.

parameters.name: InstallName
parameters.description: Specifies the install name.

parameters.name: InstallTitle
parameters.description: Specifies the install title.

parameters.name: LogName
parameters.description: Specifies an override for the default-generated log file name.

parameters.name: NoOobeDetection
parameters.description: When DeployMode is not specified or is Auto, bypasses DeployMode adjustment when the device hasn't completed the OOBE or a user ESP is active.

parameters.name: NoProcessDetection
parameters.description: When DeployMode is not specified or is Auto, bypasses DeployMode adjustment when there's no processes to close in the specified AppProcessesToClose list.

parameters.name: NoSessionDetection
parameters.description: When DeployMode is not specified or is Auto, bypasses DeployMode adjustment when there's no logged on user session available.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Passes the session object through the pipeline.

parameters.name: RequireAdmin
parameters.description: Specifies that this deployment requires administrative permissions.

parameters.name: ScriptDirectory
parameters.description: Specifies the base path for Files and SupportFiles.

parameters.name: SessionClass
parameters.description: Specifies an override for PSADT.Module.DeploymentSession class. Use this if you're deriving a class inheriting off PSAppDeployToolkit's base.

parameters.name: SessionState
parameters.description: Defaults to $PSCmdlet.SessionState to get the caller's SessionState, so only required if you need to override this.

parameters.name: SuppressRebootPassThru
parameters.description: Suppresses reboot pass-through.

parameters.name: TerminalServerMode
parameters.description: Enables Terminal Server mode.

parameters.name: UnboundArguments
parameters.description: Captures any additional arguments passed to the function.

name: Out-ADTPowerShellEncodedCommand
synopsis: Encodes a PowerShell command into a Base64 string.
description: This function takes a PowerShell command as input and encodes it into a Base64 string. This is useful for passing commands to PowerShell through mechanisms that require encoded input.

parameters.name: Command
parameters.description: The PowerShell command to be encoded.

name: Register-ADTDll
synopsis: Register a DLL file.
description: This function registers a DLL file using regsvr32.exe. It ensures that the specified DLL file exists before attempting to register it. If the file does not exist, it throws an error.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the DLL file.

name: Remove-ADTContentFromCache
synopsis: Removes the toolkit content from the cache folder on the local machine and reverts the $adtSession.DirFiles and $adtSession.SupportFiles directory.
description: This function removes the toolkit content from the cache folder on the local machine. It also reverts the $adtSession.DirFiles and $adtSession.SupportFiles directory to their original state. If the specified cache folder does not exist, it logs a message and exits.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: The path to the software cache folder.

name: Remove-ADTEdgeExtension
synopsis: Removes an extension for Microsoft Edge using the ExtensionSettings policy.
description: This function removes an extension for Microsoft Edge using the ExtensionSettings policy: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-manage-extensions-ref-guide. This enables Edge Extensions to be installed and managed like applications, enabling extensions to be pushed to specific devices or users alongside existing GPO/Intune extension policies. This should not be used in conjunction with Edge Management Service which leverages the same registry key to configure Edge extensions.

parameters.name: ExtensionID
parameters.description: The ID of the extension to remove.

name: Remove-ADTEnvironmentVariable
synopsis: Removes the specified environment variable.
description: This function removes the specified environment variable.

parameters.name: Target
parameters.description: The target of the variable to remove. This can be the machine, user, or process.

parameters.name: Variable
parameters.description: The variable to remove.

name: Remove-ADTFile
synopsis: Removes one or more items from a given path on the filesystem.
description: This function removes one or more items from a given path on the filesystem. It can handle both wildcard paths and literal paths. If the specified path does not exist, it logs a warning instead of throwing an error. The function can also delete items recursively if the Recurse parameter is specified.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: Specifies the file on the filesystem to be removed. The value of LiteralPath is used exactly as it is typed; no characters are interpreted as wildcards. Will accept an array of values.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: Specifies the file on the filesystem to be removed. The value of Path will accept wildcards. Will accept an array of values.

parameters.name: Recurse
parameters.description: Deletes the files in the specified location(s) and in all child items of the location(s).

name: Remove-ADTFileFromUserProfiles
synopsis: Removes one or more items from each user profile on the system.
description: This function removes one or more items from each user profile on the system. It can handle both wildcard paths and literal paths. If the specified path does not exist, it logs a warning instead of throwing an error. The function can also delete items recursively if the Recurse parameter is specified. Additionally, it allows excluding specific NT accounts, system profiles, service profiles, and the default user profile.

parameters.name: ExcludeDefaultUser
parameters.description: Exclude the Default User.

parameters.name: ExcludeNTAccount
parameters.description: Specify NT account names in Domain\Username format to exclude from the list of user profiles.

parameters.name: IncludeServiceProfiles
parameters.description: Include service profiles where NTAccount begins with NT SERVICE.

parameters.name: IncludeSystemProfiles
parameters.description: Include system profiles: SYSTEM, LOCAL SERVICE, NETWORK SERVICE.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: Specifies the path to append to the root of the user profile to be resolved. The value of LiteralPath is used exactly as it is typed; no characters are interpreted as wildcards. Will accept an array of values.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: Specifies the path to append to the root of the user profile to be resolved. The value of Path will accept wildcards. Will accept an array of values.

parameters.name: Recurse
parameters.description: Deletes the files in the specified location(s) and in all child items of the location(s).

name: Remove-ADTFolder
synopsis: Remove folder and files if they exist.
description: This function removes a folder and all files within it, with or without recursion, in a given path. If the specified folder does not exist, it logs a warning instead of throwing an error. The function can also delete items recursively if the DisableRecursion parameter is not specified.

parameters.name: DisableRecursion
parameters.description: Disables recursion while deleting.

parameters.name: InputObject
parameters.description: A DirectoryInfo object to remove. Available for pipelining.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: A literal path to the folder to remove.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: A path to the folder to remove. Can contain wildcards.

name: Remove-ADTHashtableNullOrEmptyValues
synopsis: Removes any key/value pairs from the supplied hashtable where the value is null.
description: This function removes any key/value pairs from the supplied hashtable where the value is null.

parameters.name: Hashtable
parameters.description: The hashtable to remove null values from.

name: Remove-ADTIniSection
synopsis: Opens an INI file and removes the specified section.
description: Opens an INI file and removes the specified section.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the INI file.

parameters.name: Section
parameters.description: Section within the INI file.

name: Remove-ADTIniValue
synopsis: Opens an INI file and removes the specified key or section.
description: Opens an INI file and removes the specified key or section.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the INI file.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: Key within the section of the INI file.

parameters.name: Section
parameters.description: Section within the INI file.

name: Remove-ADTInvalidFileNameChars
synopsis: Remove invalid characters from the supplied string.
description: This function removes invalid characters from the supplied string and returns a valid filename as a string. It ensures that the resulting string does not contain any characters that are not allowed in filenames. This function should not be used for entire paths as '\' is not a valid filename character.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Text to remove invalid filename characters from.

name: Remove-ADTModuleCallback
synopsis: Removes a callback function from the nominated hooking point.
description: This function removes a specified callback function from the nominated hooking point.

parameters.name: Callback
parameters.description: The callback function to remove from the nominated hooking point.

parameters.name: Hookpoint
parameters.description: Where you wish for the callback to be removed from.

name: Remove-ADTRegistryKey
synopsis: Deletes the specified registry key or value.
description: This function deletes the specified registry key or value. It can handle both registry keys and values, and it supports recursive deletion of registry keys. If the SID parameter is specified, it converts HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry keys to the HKEY_USERS\$SID format, allowing for the manipulation of HKCU registry settings for all users on the system.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: Literal path of the registry key to delete.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Name of the registry value to delete.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.description: Path of the registry key to delete, wildcards permitted.

parameters.name: Recurse
parameters.description: Delete registry key recursively.

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: The security identifier (SID) for a user. Specifying this parameter will convert a HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry key to the HKEY_USERS\$SID format. Specify this parameter from the Invoke-ADTAllUsersRegistryAction function to read/edit HKCU registry settings for all users on the system.

parameters.name: Wow6432Node
parameters.description: Specify this switch to read the 32-bit registry (Wow6432Node) on 64-bit systems.

name: Reset-ADTDeferHistory
synopsis: Reset the history of deferrals in the registry for the current application.
description: Reset the history of deferrals in the registry for the current application.

name: Resolve-ADTErrorRecord
synopsis: Enumerates ErrorRecord details.
description: Enumerates an ErrorRecord, or a collection of ErrorRecord properties. This function can filter and display specific properties of the ErrorRecord, and can exclude certain parts of the error details.

parameters.name: ErrorRecord
parameters.description: The ErrorRecord to resolve. For usage in a catch block, you'd use the automatic variable `$PSItem`. For usage out of a catch block, you can access the global $Error array's first error (on index 0).

parameters.name: ExcludeErrorException
parameters.description: Exclude ErrorRecord exception details as represented by $ErrorRecord.Exception.

parameters.name: ExcludeErrorInvocation
parameters.description: Exclude ErrorRecord invocation information as represented by $ErrorRecord.InvocationInfo.

parameters.name: ExcludeErrorRecord
parameters.description: Exclude ErrorRecord details as represented by $ErrorRecord.

parameters.name: IncludeErrorInnerException
parameters.description: Includes further ErrorRecord inner exception details as represented by $ErrorRecord.Exception.InnerException. Will retrieve all inner exceptions if there is more than one.

parameters.name: Property
parameters.description: The list of properties to display from the ErrorRecord. Use "*" to display all properties.

name: Send-ADTKeys
synopsis: Send a sequence of keys to one or more application windows.
description: Send a sequence of keys to one or more application windows. If the window title searched for returns more than one window, then all of them will receive the sent keys. Function does not work in SYSTEM context unless launched with "psexec.exe -s -i" to run it as an interactive process under the SYSTEM account.

parameters.name: GetAllWindowTitles
parameters.description: Get titles for all open windows on the system.

parameters.name: Keys
parameters.description: The sequence of keys to send. Info on Key input at: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/System.Windows.Forms.SendKeys(v=vs.100).aspx

parameters.name: WaitDuration
parameters.description: An optional amount of time to wait after the sending of the keys.

parameters.name: WaitSeconds
parameters.description: This parameter is obsolete and will be removed in PSAppDeployToolkit 4.2.0. Please use `-WaitDuration` instead.

parameters.name: WindowHandle
parameters.description: Send keys to a specific window where the Window Handle is already known.

parameters.name: WindowTitle
parameters.description: The title of the application window to search for using regex matching.

name: Set-ADTActiveSetup
synopsis: Creates an Active Setup entry in the registry to execute a file for each user upon login.
description: Active Setup allows handling of per-user changes registry/file changes upon login. A registry key is created in the HKLM registry hive which gets replicated to the HKCU hive when a user logs in. If the "Version" value of the Active Setup entry in HKLM is higher than the version value in HKCU, the file referenced in "StubPath" is executed. This Function: - Creates the registry entries in "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components\$($adtSession.InstallName)". - Creates StubPath value depending on the file extension of the $StubExePath parameter. - Handles Version value with YYYYMMDDHHMMSS granularity to permit re-installs on the same day and still trigger Active Setup after Version increase. - Copies/overwrites the StubPath file to $StubExePath destination path if file exists in 'Files' subdirectory of script directory. - Executes the StubPath file for the current user based on $NoExecuteForCurrentUser (no need to logout/login to trigger Active Setup).

parameters.name: Arguments
parameters.description: Arguments to pass to the file being executed.

parameters.name: DisableActiveSetup
parameters.description: Disables the Active Setup entry so that the StubPath file will not be executed. This also enables -NoExecuteForCurrentUser.

parameters.name: ExecutionPolicy
parameters.description: Specifies the ExecutionPolicy to set when StubExePath is a PowerShell script.

parameters.name: Locale
parameters.description: Optional. Arbitrary string used to specify the installation language of the file being executed. Not replicated to HKCU.

parameters.name: NoExecuteForCurrentUser
parameters.description: Specifies whether the StubExePath should be executed for the current user. Since this user is already logged in, the user won't have the application started without logging out and logging back in.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Returns a ProcessResult from the execution of the ActiveSetup configuration for the current user if `-PassThru` is provided.

parameters.name: PurgeActiveSetupKey
parameters.description: Remove Active Setup entry from HKLM registry hive. Will also load each logon user's HKCU registry hive to remove Active Setup entry. Function returns after purging.

parameters.name: StubExePath
parameters.description: Use this parameter to specify the destination path of the file that will be executed upon user login. Note: Place the file you want users to execute in the '\Files' subdirectory of the script directory and the toolkit will install it to the path specificed in this parameter.

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description: Optional. Specify version for Active setup entry. Active Setup is not triggered if Version value has more than 8 consecutive digits. Use commas to get around this limitation. Note: - Do not use this parameter if it is not necessary. PSADT will handle this parameter automatically using the time of the installation as the version number. - In Windows 10, scripts and executables might be blocked by AppLocker. Ensure that the path given to -StubExePath will permit end users to run scripts and executables unelevated.

parameters.name: Wow6432Node
parameters.description: Specify this switch to use Active Setup entry under Wow6432Node on a 64-bit OS.

name: Set-ADTDeferHistory
synopsis: Set the history of deferrals in the registry for the current application.
description: Set the history of deferrals in the registry for the current application.

parameters.name: DeferDeadline
parameters.description: Specify the deadline for the deferral.

parameters.name: DeferRunInterval
parameters.description: Specifies the time span that must elapse before prompting the user again if a process listed in 'CloseProcesses' is still running after a deferral. This helps address the issue where Intune retries installations shortly after a user defers, preventing multiple immediate prompts and improving the user experience. This parameter is specifically utilized within the `Show-ADTInstallationWelcome` function, and if specified, the current date and time will be used for the DeferRunIntervalLastTime.

parameters.name: DeferRunIntervalLastTime
parameters.description: Specifies the last time the DeferRunInterval value was tested. This is set from within `Show-ADTInstallationWelcome` as required.

parameters.name: DeferTimesRemaining
parameters.description: Specify the number of deferrals remaining.

name: Set-ADTEnvironmentVariable
synopsis: Sets the value for the specified environment variable.
description: This function sets the value for the specified environment variable.

parameters.name: Target
parameters.description: The target of the variable to set. This can be the machine, user, or process.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: The value to set to variable to.

parameters.name: Variable
parameters.description: The variable to set.

name: Set-ADTIniSection
synopsis: Opens an INI file and sets the values of the specified section.
description: Opens an INI file and sets the values of the specified section.

parameters.name: Content
parameters.description: A hashtable or dictionary object containing the key-value pairs to set in the specified section. Supply an ordered hashtable to preserve the order of supplied entries. Values can be strings, numbers, booleans, enums, or null. Supply $null or an empty hashtable in combination with -Overwrite to empty an entire section.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the INI file.

parameters.name: Force
parameters.description: Specifies whether the INI file should be created if it does not already exist.

parameters.name: Overwrite
parameters.description: Specifies whether the provided INI content should overwrite all existing section content.

parameters.name: Section
parameters.description: Section within the INI file.

name: Set-ADTIniValue
synopsis: Opens an INI file and sets the value of the specified section and key.
description: Opens an INI file and sets the value of the specified section and key.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the INI file.

parameters.name: Force
parameters.description: Specifies whether the INI file should be created if it does not already exist.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: Key within the section of the INI file.

parameters.name: Section
parameters.description: Section within the INI file.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: Value for the key within the section of the INI file.

name: Set-ADTItemPermission
synopsis: Allows you to easily change permissions on files or folders.
description: Allows you to easily change permissions on files or folders for a given user or group. You can add, remove or replace permissions, set inheritance and propagation.

parameters.name: AccessControlList
parameters.description: The ACL object to apply to the given path.

parameters.name: DisableInheritance
parameters.description: Disables inheritance, preserving permissions before doing so.

parameters.name: EnableInheritance
parameters.description: Enables inheritance on the files/folders.

parameters.name: Inheritance
parameters.description: Sets permission inheritance. Does not apply to files. Multiple options can be specified. * None - The permission entry is not inherited by child objects. * ObjectInherit - The permission entry is inherited by child leaf objects. * ContainerInherit - The permission entry is inherited by child container objects.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: Path to the folder or file you want to modify (ex: C:\Temp)

parameters.name: Method
parameters.description: Specifies which method will be used to apply the permissions. * AddAccessRule - Adds permissions rules but it does not remove previous permissions. * SetAccessRule - Overwrites matching permission rules with new ones. * ResetAccessRule - Removes matching permissions rules and then adds permission rules. * RemoveAccessRule - Removes matching permission rules. * RemoveAccessRuleAll - Removes all permission rules for specified user/s. * RemoveAccessRuleSpecific - Removes specific permissions.

parameters.name: Permission
parameters.description: Permission or list of permissions to be set/added/removed/replaced. Permission DeleteSubdirectoriesAndFiles does not apply to files.

parameters.name: PermissionType
parameters.description: Sets Access Control Type of the permissions.

parameters.name: Propagation
parameters.description: Sets how to propagate inheritance. Does not apply to files. * None - Specifies that no inheritance flags are set. * NoPropagateInherit - Specifies that the permission entry is not propagated to child objects. * InheritOnly - Specifies that the permission entry is propagated only to child objects. This includes both container and leaf child objects.

parameters.name: RemoveExplicitRules
parameters.description: Removes non-inherited permissions from the object when enabling inheritance.

parameters.name: User
parameters.description: One or more user names (ex: BUILTIN\Users, DOMAIN\Admin) to give the permissions to. If you want to use SID, prefix it with an asterisk * (ex: *S-1-5-18)

name: Set-ADTMsiProperty
synopsis: Set a property in the MSI property table.
description: Set a property in the MSI property table.

parameters.name: Database
parameters.description: Specify a ComObject representing an MSI database opened in view/modify/update mode.

parameters.name: PropertyName
parameters.description: The name of the property to be set/modified.

parameters.name: PropertyValue
parameters.description: The value of the property to be set/modified.

name: Set-ADTPowerShellCulture
synopsis: Changes the current thread's Culture and UICulture to the specified culture.
description: This function changes the current thread's Culture and UICulture to the specified culture.

parameters.name: CultureInfo
parameters.description: The culture to set the current thread's Culture and UICulture to. Can be a CultureInfo object, or any valid IETF BCP 47 language tag.

name: Set-ADTRegistryKey
synopsis: Creates or sets a registry key name, value, and value data.
description: Creates a registry key name, value, and value data; it sets the same if it already exists. This function can also handle registry keys for specific user SIDs and 32-bit registry on 64-bit systems.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: The registry key path.

parameters.name: MultiStringValueMode
parameters.description: The mode to operate when working with MultiString objects. The default is replace, but add and remove modes are supported also.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The value name.

parameters.name: RegistryOptions
parameters.description: Extra options to use while creating the key. This is useful for creating volatile keys that do not survive a reboot.

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: The security identifier (SID) for a user. Specifying this parameter will convert a HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry key to the HKEY_USERS\$SID format. Specify this parameter from the Invoke-ADTAllUsersRegistryAction function to read/edit HKCU registry settings for all users on the system.

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: The type of registry value to create or set. DWord should be specified as a decimal.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: The value data.

parameters.name: Wow6432Node
parameters.description: Specify this switch to write to the 32-bit registry (Wow6432Node) on 64-bit systems.

name: Set-ADTServiceStartMode
synopsis: Set the service startup mode.
description: Set the service startup mode. This function allows you to configure the startup mode of a specified service. The startup modes available are: Automatic, Automatic (Delayed Start), Manual, Disabled, Boot, and System.

parameters.name: Service
parameters.description: Specify the name of the service.

parameters.name: StartMode
parameters.description: Specify startup mode for the service. Options: Automatic, Automatic (Delayed Start), Manual, Disabled, Boot, System.

name: Set-ADTShortcut
synopsis: Modifies a .lnk or .url type shortcut.
description: Modifies a shortcut - .lnk or .url file, with configurable options. Only specify the parameters that you want to change.

parameters.name: Arguments
parameters.description: Sets the arguments used against the target path.

parameters.name: Description
