parameters.description: Sets the description of the shortcut as can be seen in the shortcut's properties.

parameters.name: HotKey
parameters.description: Sets the hotkey to launch the shortcut, e.g. "CTRL+SHIFT+F".

parameters.name: IconIndex
parameters.description: Sets the index of the icon. Executables, DLLs, ICO files with multiple icons need the icon index to be specified. This parameter is an Integer. The first index is 0.

parameters.name: IconLocation
parameters.description: Sets location of the icon used for the shortcut.

parameters.name: LiteralPath
parameters.description: Path to the shortcut to be changed.

parameters.name: RunAsAdmin
parameters.description: Sets the shortcut to require elevated permissions to run.

parameters.name: TargetPath
parameters.description: Sets target path or URL that the shortcut launches.

parameters.name: WindowStyle
parameters.description: Sets the shortcut's window style to be minimised, maximised, etc.

parameters.name: WorkingDirectory
parameters.description: Sets working directory to be used for the target path.

name: Show-ADTBalloonTip
synopsis: Displays a balloon tip notification in the system tray.
description: Displays a balloon tip notification in the system tray. This function can be used to show notifications to the user with customizable text, title, icon, and display duration. For Windows 10 and above, balloon tips automatically get translated by the system into toast notifications.

parameters.name: BalloonTipIcon
parameters.description: Icon to be used. Options: 'Error', 'Info', 'None', 'Warning'.

parameters.name: BalloonTipText
parameters.description: Text of the balloon tip.

parameters.name: BalloonTipTime
parameters.description: Time in milliseconds to display the balloon tip. Default: 10000.

parameters.name: Force
parameters.description: Creates the balloon tip irrespective of whether running silently or not.

parameters.name: NoWait
parameters.description: Creates the balloon tip asynchronously.

name: Show-ADTDialogBox
synopsis: Display a custom dialog box with optional title, buttons, icon, and timeout.
description: Display a custom dialog box with optional title, buttons, icon, and timeout. The default button is "OK", the default Icon is "None", and the default Timeout is None. Show-ADTInstallationPrompt is recommended over this function as it provides more customization and uses consistent branding with the other UI components.

parameters.name: Buttons
parameters.description: The button(s) to display on the dialog box.

parameters.name: DefaultButton
parameters.description: The Default button that is selected. Options: First, Second, Third.

parameters.name: ExitOnTimeout
parameters.description: Specifies whether to not exit the script if the UI times out.

parameters.name: Force
parameters.description: Specifies whether the message box should appear irrespective of an ongoing DeploymentSession's DeployMode.

parameters.name: Icon
parameters.description: Icon to display on the dialog box. Options: None, Stop, Question, Exclamation, Information.

parameters.name: NotTopMost
parameters.description: Specifies whether the message box shouldn't be a system modal message box that appears in a topmost window.

parameters.name: NoWait
parameters.description: Presents the dialog in a separate, independent thread so that the main process isn't stalled waiting for a response.

parameters.name: Text
parameters.description: Text in the message dialog box.
parameters.placeholder: Installation will take approximately 30 minutes. Do you wish to proceed?

name: Show-ADTHelpConsole
synopsis: Displays a help console for the ADT module.
description: Displays a help console for the ADT module in a new PowerShell window. The console provides a graphical interface to browse and view detailed help information for all commands exported by the ADT module. The help console includes a list box to select commands and a text box to display the full help content for the selected command.

name: Show-ADTInstallationProgress
synopsis: Displays a progress dialog in a separate thread with an updateable custom message.
description: Creates a WPF window in a separate thread to display a marquee style progress ellipse with a custom message that can be updated. The status message supports line breaks. The first time this function is called in a script, it will display a balloon tip notification to indicate that the installation has started (provided balloon tips are enabled in the config.psd1 file).

parameters.name: AllowMove
parameters.description: Specifies that the user can move the dialog on the screen.

parameters.name: MessageAlignment
parameters.description: The text alignment to use for the status message.

parameters.name: NotTopMost
parameters.description: Specifies whether the progress window shouldn't be topmost.

parameters.name: StatusBarPercentage
parameters.description: The percentage to display on the status bar. If null or not supplied, the status bar will continuously scroll.

parameters.name: StatusMessage
parameters.description: The status message to be displayed. The default status message is taken from the imported strings.psd1 file.

parameters.name: StatusMessageDetail
parameters.description: The status message detail to be displayed with a fluent progress window. The default status message is taken from the imported strings.psd1 file.

parameters.name: WindowLocation
parameters.description: The location of the dialog on the screen.

name: Show-ADTInstallationPrompt
synopsis: Displays a custom installation prompt with the toolkit branding and optional buttons.
description: Displays a custom installation prompt with the toolkit branding and optional buttons. Any combination of Left, Middle, or Right buttons can be displayed. The return value of the button clicked by the user is the button text specified. The prompt can also display a system icon and be configured to persist, minimize other windows, or timeout after a specified period.

parameters.name: AllowMove
parameters.description: Specifies that the user can move the dialog on the screen.

parameters.name: ButtonLeftText
parameters.description: Show a button on the left of the prompt with the specified text.

parameters.name: ButtonMiddleText
parameters.description: Show a button in the middle of the prompt with the specified text.

parameters.name: ButtonRightText
parameters.description: Show a button on the right of the prompt with the specified text.

parameters.name: DefaultValue
parameters.description: The default value to show in the text box.

parameters.name: Icon
parameters.description: Show a system icon in the prompt.

parameters.name: Message
parameters.description: The message text to be displayed on the prompt.

parameters.name: MessageAlignment
parameters.description: Alignment of the message text.

parameters.name: MinimizeWindows
parameters.description: Specifies whether to minimize other windows when displaying prompt.

parameters.name: NoExitOnTimeout
parameters.description: Specifies whether to not exit the script if the UI times out.

parameters.name: NotTopMost
parameters.description: Specifies whether the prompt shouldn't be topmost, above all other windows.

parameters.name: NoWait
parameters.description: Presents the dialog in a separate, independent thread so that the main process isn't stalled waiting for a response.

parameters.name: PersistPrompt
parameters.description: Specify whether to make the prompt persist in the center of the screen every couple of seconds, specified in the config.psd1 file. The user will have no option but to respond to the prompt.

parameters.name: RequestInput
parameters.description: Show a text box for the user to provide an answer.

parameters.name: WindowLocation
parameters.description: The location of the dialog on the screen.

name: Show-ADTInstallationRestartPrompt
synopsis: Displays a restart prompt with a countdown to a forced restart.
description: Displays a restart prompt with a countdown to a forced restart. The prompt can be customized with a title, countdown duration, and whether it should be topmost. It also supports silent mode where the restart can be triggered without user interaction.

parameters.name: AllowMove
parameters.description: Specifies that the user can move the dialog on the screen.

parameters.name: CountdownNoHideSeconds
parameters.description: Specifies the number of seconds to display the restart prompt without allowing the window to be hidden.

parameters.name: CountdownSeconds
parameters.description: Specifies the number of seconds to display the restart prompt.

parameters.name: CustomText
parameters.description: Specify whether to display a custom message specified in the `strings.psd1` file. Custom message must be populated for each language section in the `strings.psd1` file.

parameters.name: NoCountdown
parameters.description: Specifies whether the user should receive a prompt to immediately restart their workstation.

parameters.name: NotTopMost
parameters.description: Specifies whether the prompt shouldn't be topmost, above all other windows.

parameters.name: SilentCountdownSeconds
parameters.description: Specifies number of seconds to countdown for the restart when the toolkit is running in silent mode and `-SilentRestart` isn't specified.

parameters.name: SilentRestart
parameters.description: Specifies whether the restart should be triggered when DeployMode is silent or very silent.

parameters.name: WindowLocation
parameters.description: The location of the dialog on the screen.

name: Show-ADTInstallationWelcome
synopsis: Show a welcome dialog prompting the user with information about the deployment and actions to be performed before the deployment can begin.
description: The following prompts can be included in the welcome dialog: * Close the specified running applications, or optionally close the applications without showing a prompt (using the `-Silent` switch). * Defer the deployment a certain number of times, for a certain number of days or until a deadline is reached. * Countdown until applications are automatically closed. * Prevent users from launching the specified applications while the deployment is in progress.

parameters.name: AllowDefer
parameters.description: Enables an optional defer button to allow the user to defer the deployment.

parameters.name: AllowDeferCloseProcesses
parameters.description: Enables an optional defer button to allow the user to defer the deployment only if there are running applications that need to be closed. This parameter automatically enables `-AllowDefer`.

parameters.name: AllowMove
parameters.description: Specifies that the user can move the dialog on the screen.

parameters.name: BlockExecution
parameters.description: Option to prevent the user from launching processes/applications, specified in -CloseProcesses, during the deployment.

parameters.name: CheckDiskSpace
parameters.description: Specify whether to check if there is enough disk space for the deployment to proceed. If this parameter is specified without the RequiredDiskSpace parameter, the required disk space is calculated automatically based on the size of the script source and associated files.

parameters.name: CloseProcesses
parameters.description: Name of the process to stop (do not include the .exe). Specify multiple processes separated by a comma. Specify custom descriptions like this: `@{ Name = 'winword'; Description = 'Microsoft Office Word' }, @{ Name = 'excel'; Description = 'Microsoft Office Excel' }`

parameters.name: CloseProcessesCountdown
parameters.description: Option to provide a countdown in seconds until the specified applications are automatically closed. This only takes effect if deferral is not allowed or has expired.

parameters.name: CustomText
parameters.description: Specify whether to display a custom message as specified in the `strings.psd1` file below the main preamble. Custom message must be populated for each language section in the `strings.psd1` file.

parameters.name: DeferDays
parameters.description: Specify the number of days since first run that the deployment can be deferred. This is converted to a deadline.

parameters.name: DeferDeadline
parameters.description: Specify the deadline date until which the deployment can be deferred. Specify the date in the local culture if the script is intended for that same culture. If the script is intended to run on en-US machines, specify the date in the format: `08/25/2013`, or `08-25-2013`, or `08-25-2013 18:00:00`. If the script is intended for multiple cultures, specify the date in the universal sortable date/time format: `2013-08-22 11:51:52Z`. The deadline date will be displayed to the user in the format of their culture.

parameters.name: DeferRunInterval
parameters.description: Specifies the time span that must elapse before prompting the user again if a process listed in 'CloseProcesses' is still running after a deferral. This addresses the issue where Intune retries deployments shortly after a user defers, preventing multiple immediate prompts and improving the user experience. Example: - To specify 30 minutes, use: `([System.TimeSpan]::FromMinutes(30))`. - To specify 24 hours, use: `([System.TimeSpan]::FromHours(24))`.

parameters.name: DeferTimes
parameters.description: Specify the number of times the deployment can be deferred.

parameters.name: ForceCloseProcessesCountdown
parameters.description: Option to provide a countdown in seconds until the specified applications are automatically closed regardless of whether deferral is allowed.

parameters.name: ForceCountdown
parameters.description: Specify a countdown to display before automatically proceeding with the deployment when a deferral is enabled.

parameters.name: HideCloseButton
parameters.description: Specifies that the 'Close Processes' button be hidden/disabled to force users to manually close down their running processes.

parameters.name: MinimizeWindows
parameters.description: Specifies whether to minimize other windows when displaying prompt.

parameters.name: NoMinimizeWindows
parameters.description: This parameter will be removed in PSAppDeployToolkit 4.2.0.

parameters.name: NotTopMost
parameters.description: Specifies whether the windows is the topmost window.

parameters.name: PersistPrompt
parameters.description: Specify whether to make the Show-ADTInstallationWelcome prompt persist in the center of the screen every couple of seconds, specified in the config.psd1. The user will have no option but to respond to the prompt. This only takes effect if deferral is not allowed or has expired.

parameters.name: PromptToSave
parameters.description: Specify whether to prompt to save working documents when the user chooses to close applications by selecting the "Close Programs" button. Option does not work in SYSTEM context unless toolkit launched with "psexec.exe -s -i" to run it as an interactive process under the SYSTEM account.

parameters.name: RequiredDiskSpace
parameters.description: Specify required disk space in MB, used in combination with CheckDiskSpace.

parameters.name: Silent
parameters.description: Stop processes without prompting the user.

parameters.name: WindowLocation
parameters.description: The location of the dialog on the screen.

name: Start-ADTMsiProcess
synopsis: Executes msiexec.exe to perform actions such as install, uninstall, patch, repair, or active setup for MSI and MSP files or MSI product codes.
description: This function utilizes msiexec.exe to handle various operations on MSI and MSP files, as well as MSI product codes. The operations include installation, uninstallation, patching, repair, and setting up active configurations. If the -Action parameter is set to "Install" and the MSI is already installed, the function will terminate without performing any actions. The function automatically sets default switches for msiexec based on preferences defined in the config.psd1 file. Additionally, it generates a log file name and creates a verbose log for all msiexec operations, ensuring detailed tracking. The MSI or MSP file is expected to reside in the "Files" subdirectory of the App Deploy Toolkit, with transform files expected to be in the same directory as the MSI file.

parameters.name: Action
parameters.description: Specifies the action to be performed. Available options: Install, Uninstall, Patch, Repair, ActiveSetup.

parameters.name: AdditionalArgumentList
parameters.description: Adds additional parameters to the default set specified in the config.psd1 file.

parameters.name: ArgumentList
parameters.description: Overrides the default parameters specified in the config.psd1 file.

parameters.name: ExitOnProcessFailure
parameters.description: Automatically closes the active deployment session via Close-ADTSession in the event the process exits with a non-success or non-ignored exit code.

parameters.name: ExpandEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether to expand any Windows/DOS-style environment variables in the specified FilePath/ArgumentList.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: The file path to the MSI/MSP file.

parameters.name: IgnoreExitCodes
parameters.description: List the exit codes to ignore or * to ignore all exit codes.

parameters.name: IncludeUpdatesAndHotfixes
parameters.description: Include matches against updates and hotfixes in results.

parameters.name: InheritEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether the process running as a user should inherit the SYSTEM account's environment variables.

parameters.name: InstalledApplication
parameters.description: The InstalledApplication object of the installed MSI.

parameters.name: LogFileName
parameters.description: Overrides the default log file name. The default log file name is generated from the MSI file name. If LogFileName does not end in .log, it will be automatically appended. For uninstallations, by default the product code is resolved to the DisplayName and version of the application.

parameters.name: LoggingOptions
parameters.description: Overrides the default logging options specified in the config.psd1 file.

parameters.name: NoDesktopRefresh
parameters.description: If specifies, doesn't refresh the desktop and environment after successful MSI installation.

parameters.name: NoWait
parameters.description: Immediately continue after executing the process.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Returns ExitCode, StdOut, and StdErr output from the process. Note that a failed execution will only return an object if either `-ErrorAction` is set to `SilentlyContinue`/`Ignore`, or if `-IgnoreExitCodes`/`-SuccessExitCodes` are used.

parameters.name: Patches
parameters.description: The name(s) of the patch (MSP) file(s) to be applied to the MSI for the "Install" action. The patch files should be in the same directory as the MSI file.

parameters.name: PriorityClass
parameters.description: Specifies priority class for the process. Options: Idle, Normal, High, AboveNormal, BelowNormal, RealTime.

parameters.name: ProductCode
parameters.description: The product code of the installed MSI.

parameters.name: RebootExitCodes
parameters.description: List of exit codes to indicate a reboot is required. Defaults to values set during ADTSession initialization, otherwise: 1641, 3010

parameters.name: RepairFromSource
parameters.description: Specifies whether we should repair from source. Also rewrites local cache.

parameters.name: RepairMode
parameters.description: Specifies the mode of repair. Choosing `Repair` will repair via `msiexec.exe /p` (which can trigger unsupressable reboots). Choosing `Reinstall` will reinstall by adding `REINSTALL=ALL REINSTALLMODE=omus` to the standard InstallParams.

parameters.name: RunAsActiveUser
parameters.description: A RunAsActiveUser object to invoke the process as.

parameters.name: SecureArgumentList
parameters.description: Hides all parameters passed to the MSI or MSP file from the toolkit log file.

parameters.name: SkipMSIAlreadyInstalledCheck
parameters.description: Skips the check to determine if the MSI is already installed on the system.

parameters.name: SuccessExitCodes
parameters.description: List of exit codes to be considered successful. Defaults to values set during ADTSession initialization, otherwise: 0

parameters.name: Transforms
parameters.description: The name(s) of the transform file(s) to be applied to the MSI. The transform files should be in the same directory as the MSI file.

parameters.name: UseHighestAvailableToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token if it's available while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: UseLinkedAdminToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: UseUnelevatedToken
parameters.description: If the current process is elevated, starts the new process unelevated using the user's unelevated linked token.

parameters.name: WorkingDirectory
parameters.description: Overrides the working directory. The working directory is set to the location of the MSI file.

name: Start-ADTMsiProcessAsUser
synopsis: Executes msiexec.exe to perform actions such as install, uninstall, patch, repair, or active setup for MSI and MSP files or MSI product codes.
description: This function utilizes msiexec.exe to handle various operations on MSI and MSP files, as well as MSI product codes. The operations include installation, uninstallation, patching, repair, and setting up active configurations. If the -Action parameter is set to "Install" and the MSI is already installed, the function will terminate without performing any actions. The function automatically sets default switches for msiexec based on preferences defined in the config.psd1 file. Additionally, it generates a log file name and creates a verbose log for all msiexec operations, ensuring detailed tracking. The MSI or MSP file is expected to reside in the "Files" subdirectory of the App Deploy Toolkit, with transform files expected to be in the same directory as the MSI file.

parameters.name: Action
parameters.description: Specifies the action to be performed. Available options: Install, Uninstall, Patch, Repair, ActiveSetup.

parameters.name: AdditionalArgumentList
parameters.description: Adds additional parameters to the default set specified in the config.psd1 file.

parameters.name: ArgumentList
parameters.description: Overrides the default parameters specified in the config.psd1 file.

parameters.name: ExitOnProcessFailure
parameters.description: Automatically closes the active deployment session via Close-ADTSession in the event the process exits with a non-success or non-ignored exit code.

parameters.name: ExpandEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether to expand any Windows/DOS-style environment variables in the specified FilePath/ArgumentList.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: The file path to the MSI/MSP file.

parameters.name: IgnoreExitCodes
parameters.description: List the exit codes to ignore or * to ignore all exit codes.

parameters.name: IncludeUpdatesAndHotfixes
parameters.description: Include matches against updates and hotfixes in results.

parameters.name: InheritEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether the process running as a user should inherit the SYSTEM account's environment variables.

parameters.name: InstalledApplication
parameters.description: The InstalledApplication object of the installed MSI.

parameters.name: LogFileName
parameters.description: Overrides the default log file name. The default log file name is generated from the MSI file name. If LogFileName does not end in .log, it will be automatically appended. For uninstallations, by default the product code is resolved to the DisplayName and version of the application.

parameters.name: LoggingOptions
parameters.description: Overrides the default logging options specified in the config.psd1 file.

parameters.name: NoDesktopRefresh
parameters.description: If specifies, doesn't refresh the desktop and environment after successful MSI installation.

parameters.name: NoWait
parameters.description: Immediately continue after executing the process.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Returns ExitCode, StdOut, and StdErr output from the process. Note that a failed execution will only return an object if either `-ErrorAction` is set to `SilentlyContinue`/`Ignore`, or if `-IgnoreExitCodes`/`-SuccessExitCodes` are used.

parameters.name: Patches
parameters.description: The name(s) of the patch (MSP) file(s) to be applied to the MSI for the "Install" action. The patch files should be in the same directory as the MSI file.

parameters.name: PriorityClass
parameters.description: Specifies priority class for the process. Options: Idle, Normal, High, AboveNormal, BelowNormal, RealTime.

parameters.name: ProductCode
parameters.description: The product code of the installed MSI.

parameters.name: RebootExitCodes
parameters.description: List of exit codes to indicate a reboot is required. Defaults to values set during ADTSession initialization, otherwise: 1641, 3010

parameters.name: RepairFromSource
parameters.description: Specifies whether we should repair from source. Also rewrites local cache.

parameters.name: RepairMode
parameters.description: Specifies the mode of repair. Choosing `Repair` will repair via `msiexec.exe /p` (which can trigger unsupressable reboots). Choosing `Reinstall` will reinstall by adding `REINSTALL=ALL REINSTALLMODE=omus` to the standard InstallParams.

parameters.name: SecureArgumentList
parameters.description: Hides all parameters passed to the MSI or MSP file from the toolkit log file.

parameters.name: SkipMSIAlreadyInstalledCheck
parameters.description: Skips the check to determine if the MSI is already installed on the system.

parameters.name: SuccessExitCodes
parameters.description: List of exit codes to be considered successful. Defaults to values set during ADTSession initialization, otherwise: 0

parameters.name: Transforms
parameters.description: The name(s) of the transform file(s) to be applied to the MSI. The transform files should be in the same directory as the MSI file.

parameters.name: UseHighestAvailableToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token if it's available while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: UseLinkedAdminToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: Username
parameters.description: A username to invoke the process as. Only supported while running as the SYSTEM account.

parameters.name: WorkingDirectory
parameters.description: Overrides the working directory. The working directory is set to the location of the MSI file.

name: Start-ADTMspProcess
synopsis: Executes an MSP file using the same logic as Start-ADTMsiProcess.
description: Reads SummaryInfo targeted product codes in MSP file and determines if the MSP file applies to any installed products. If a valid installed product is found, triggers the Start-ADTMsiProcess function to patch the installation. Uses default config MSI parameters. You can use -AdditionalArgumentList to add additional parameters.

parameters.name: AdditionalArgumentList
parameters.description: Additional parameters.

parameters.name: ExpandEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether to expand any Windows/DOS-style environment variables in the specified FilePath/ArgumentList.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the MSP file.

parameters.name: InheritEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether the process running as a user should inherit the SYSTEM account's environment variables.

parameters.name: RunAsActiveUser
parameters.description: A RunAsActiveUser object to invoke the process as.

parameters.name: UseHighestAvailableToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token if it's available while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: UseLinkedAdminToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: UseUnelevatedToken
parameters.description: If the current process is elevated, starts the new process unelevated using the user's unelevated linked token.

name: Start-ADTMspProcessAsUser
synopsis: Executes an MSP file using the same logic as Start-ADTMsiProcess.
description: Reads SummaryInfo targeted product codes in MSP file and determines if the MSP file applies to any installed products. If a valid installed product is found, triggers the Start-ADTMsiProcess function to patch the installation. Uses default config MSI parameters. You can use -AdditionalArgumentList to add additional parameters.

parameters.name: AdditionalArgumentList
parameters.description: Additional parameters.

parameters.name: ExpandEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether to expand any Windows/DOS-style environment variables in the specified FilePath/ArgumentList.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the MSP file.

parameters.name: InheritEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether the process running as a user should inherit the SYSTEM account's environment variables.

parameters.name: UseHighestAvailableToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token if it's available while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: UseLinkedAdminToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: Username
parameters.description: A username to invoke the process as. Only supported while running as the SYSTEM account.

name: Start-ADTProcess
synopsis: Execute a process with optional arguments, working directory, window style.
description: Executes a process, e.g. a file included in the Files directory of the App Deploy Toolkit, or a file on the local machine. Provides various options for handling the return codes (see Parameters).

parameters.name: ArgumentList
parameters.description: Arguments to be passed to the executable.

parameters.name: CreateNoWindow
parameters.description: Specifies whether the process should be started with a new window to contain it.

parameters.name: ExitOnProcessFailure
parameters.description: Automatically closes the active deployment session via Close-ADTSession in the event the process exits with a non-success or non-ignored exit code.

parameters.name: ExpandEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether to expand any Windows/DOS-style environment variables in the specified FilePath/ArgumentList.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the file to be executed. If the file is located directly in the "Files" directory of the App Deploy Toolkit, only the file name needs to be specified. Otherwise, the full path of the file must be specified. If the files is in a subdirectory of "Files", use the "$($adtSession.DirFiles)" variable as shown in the example.

parameters.name: IgnoreExitCodes
parameters.description: List the exit codes to ignore or * to ignore all exit codes. Where possible, please use `-SuccessExitCodes` and/or `-RebootExitCodes` instead.

parameters.name: InheritEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether the process running as a user should inherit the SYSTEM account's environment variables.

parameters.name: KillChildProcessesWithParent
parameters.description: Specifies whether any child processes started by the provided executable should be closed when the provided executable closes. This is handy for application installs that open web browsers and other programs that cannot be suppressed.

parameters.name: MsiExecWaitTime
parameters.description: Specify the length of time in seconds to wait for the msiexec engine to become available.

parameters.name: NoStreamLogging
parameters.description: Don't log any available stdout/stderr data to the log file.

parameters.name: NoTerminateOnTimeout
parameters.description: Indicates that the process should not be terminated on timeout. Only supported for GUI-based applications.

parameters.name: NoWait
parameters.description: Immediately continue after executing the process.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: If `-NoWait` is not specified, returns an object with ExitCode, StdOut, and StdErr output from the process. If `-NoWait` is specified, returns a task that can be awaited. Note that a failed execution will only return an object if either `-ErrorAction` is set to `SilentlyContinue`/`Ignore`, or if `-IgnoreExitCodes`/`-SuccessExitCodes` are used.

parameters.name: PriorityClass
parameters.description: Specifies priority class for the process. Options: Idle, Normal, High, AboveNormal, BelowNormal, RealTime.

parameters.name: RebootExitCodes
parameters.description: List of exit codes to indicate a reboot is required. Defaults to values set during ADTSession initialization, otherwise: 1641, 3010

parameters.name: RunAsActiveUser
parameters.description: A RunAsActiveUser object to invoke the process as.

parameters.name: SecureArgumentList
parameters.description: Hides all parameters passed to the executable from the Toolkit log file.

parameters.name: StreamEncoding
parameters.description: Specifies the encoding type to use when reading stdout/stderr. Some apps like WinGet encode using UTF8, which will corrupt if incorrectly set.

parameters.name: SuccessExitCodes
parameters.description: List of exit codes to be considered successful. Defaults to values set during ADTSession initialization, otherwise: 0

parameters.name: Timeout
parameters.description: How long to wait for the process before timing out.

parameters.name: TimeoutAction
parameters.description: What action to take on timeout. Follows ErrorAction if not specified.

parameters.name: UseHighestAvailableToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token if it's available while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: UseLinkedAdminToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: UseShellExecute
parameters.description: Specifies whether to use the operating system shell to start the process. $true if the shell should be used when starting the process; $false if the process should be created directly from the executable file. The word "Shell" in this context refers to a graphical shell (similar to the Windows shell) rather than command shells (for example, bash or sh) and lets users launch graphical applications or open documents. It lets you open a file or a url and the Shell will figure out the program to open it with. The WorkingDirectory property behaves differently depending on the value of the UseShellExecute property. When UseShellExecute is true, the WorkingDirectory property specifies the location of the executable. When UseShellExecute is false, the WorkingDirectory property is not used to find the executable. Instead, it is used only by the process that is started and has meaning only within the context of the new process. If you set UseShellExecute to $true, there will be no available output from the process.

parameters.name: UseUnelevatedToken
parameters.description: If the current process is elevated, starts the new process unelevated using the user's unelevated linked token.

parameters.name: Verb
parameters.description: The verb to use when doing a ShellExecute invocation. Common usages are "runas" to trigger a UAC elevation of the process.

parameters.name: WaitForChildProcesses
parameters.description: Specifies whether the started process should be considered finished only when any child processes it spawns have finished also.

parameters.name: WaitForMsiExec
parameters.description: Sometimes an EXE bootstrapper will launch an MSI install. In such cases, this variable will ensure that this function waits for the msiexec engine to become available before starting the install.

parameters.name: WindowStyle
parameters.description: Style of the window of the process executed. Options: Normal, Hidden, Maximized, Minimized. Only works for native Windows GUI applications. If the WindowStyle is set to Hidden, UseShellExecute should be set to $true. Note: Not all processes honor WindowStyle. WindowStyle is a recommendation passed to the process. They can choose to ignore it.

parameters.name: WorkingDirectory
parameters.description: The working directory used for executing the process. Defaults to DirFiles if there is an active DeploymentSession. The use of UseShellExecute affects this parameter.

name: Start-ADTProcessAsUser
synopsis: Invokes a process in another user's session.
description: Invokes a process from SYSTEM in another user's session.

parameters.name: ArgumentList
parameters.description: Arguments to be passed to the executable.

parameters.name: CreateNoWindow
parameters.description: Specifies whether the process should be started with a new window to contain it.

parameters.name: ExitOnProcessFailure
parameters.description: Automatically closes the active deployment session via Close-ADTSession in the event the process exits with a non-success or non-ignored exit code.

parameters.name: ExpandEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether to expand any Windows/DOS-style environment variables in the specified FilePath/ArgumentList.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the file to be executed. If the file is located directly in the "Files" directory of the App Deploy Toolkit, only the file name needs to be specified. Otherwise, the full path of the file must be specified. If the files is in a subdirectory of "Files", use the "$($adtSession.DirFiles)" variable as shown in the example.

parameters.name: IgnoreExitCodes
parameters.description: List the exit codes to ignore or * to ignore all exit codes.

parameters.name: InheritEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: Specifies whether the process running as a user should inherit the SYSTEM account's environment variables.

parameters.name: KillChildProcessesWithParent
parameters.description: Specifies whether any child processes started by the provided executable should be closed when the provided executable closes. This is handy for application installs that open web browsers and other programs that cannot be suppressed.

parameters.name: MsiExecWaitTime
parameters.description: Specify the length of time in seconds to wait for the msiexec engine to become available.

parameters.name: NoStreamLogging
parameters.description: Don't log any available stdout/stderr data to the log file.

parameters.name: NoTerminateOnTimeout
parameters.description: Indicates that the process should not be terminated on timeout. Only supported for GUI-based applications, or when -CreateNoWindow isn't specified.

parameters.name: NoWait
parameters.description: Immediately continue after executing the process.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: If `-NoWait` is not specified, returns an object with ExitCode, StdOut, and StdErr output from the process. If `-NoWait` is specified, returns a task that can be awaited. Note that a failed execution will only return an object if either `-ErrorAction` is set to `SilentlyContinue`/`Ignore`, or if `-IgnoreExitCodes`/`-SuccessExitCodes` are used.

parameters.name: PriorityClass
parameters.description: Specifies priority class for the process. Options: Idle, Normal, High, AboveNormal, BelowNormal, RealTime.

parameters.name: RebootExitCodes
parameters.description: List of exit codes to indicate a reboot is required. Defaults to values set during ADTSession initialization, otherwise: 1641, 3010

parameters.name: SecureArgumentList
parameters.description: Hides all parameters passed to the executable from the Toolkit log file.

parameters.name: StreamEncoding
parameters.description: Specifies the encoding type to use when reading stdout/stderr. Some apps like WinGet encode using UTF8, which will corrupt if incorrectly set.

parameters.name: SuccessExitCodes
parameters.description: List of exit codes to be considered successful. Defaults to values set during ADTSession initialization, otherwise: 0

parameters.name: Timeout
parameters.description: How long to wait for the process before timing out.

parameters.name: TimeoutAction
parameters.description: What action to take on timeout. Follows ErrorAction if not specified.

parameters.name: UseHighestAvailableToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token if it's available while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: UseLinkedAdminToken
parameters.description: Use a user's linked administrative token while running the process under their context.

parameters.name: Username
parameters.description: A username to invoke the process as. Only supported while running as the SYSTEM account.

parameters.name: WaitForChildProcesses
parameters.description: Specifies whether the started process should be considered finished only when any child processes it spawns have finished also.

parameters.name: WaitForMsiExec
parameters.description: Sometimes an EXE bootstrapper will launch an MSI install. In such cases, this variable will ensure that this function waits for the msiexec engine to become available before starting the install.

parameters.name: WindowStyle
parameters.description: Style of the window of the process executed. Options: Normal, Hidden, Maximized, Minimized. Only works for native Windows GUI applications. If the WindowStyle is set to Hidden, UseShellExecute should be set to $true. Note: Not all processes honor WindowStyle. WindowStyle is a recommendation passed to the process. They can choose to ignore it.

parameters.name: WorkingDirectory
parameters.description: The working directory used for executing the process. Defaults to the directory of the file being executed. The use of UseShellExecute affects this parameter.

name: Start-ADTServiceAndDependencies
synopsis: Start a Windows service and its dependencies.
description: This function starts a specified Windows service and its dependencies. It provides options to skip starting dependent services, wait for a service to get out of a pending state, and return the service object.

parameters.name: InputObject
parameters.description: A ServiceController object to start.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the service.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Return the System.ServiceProcess.ServiceController service object.

parameters.name: PendingStatusWait
parameters.description: The amount of time to wait for a service to get out of a pending state before continuing. Default is 60 seconds.

parameters.name: SkipDependentServices
parameters.description: Choose to skip checking for and starting dependent services.

name: Stop-ADTServiceAndDependencies
synopsis: Stop a Windows service and its dependencies.
description: This function stops a specified Windows service and its dependencies. It provides options to skip stopping dependent services, wait for a service to get out of a pending state, and return the service object.

parameters.name: InputObject
parameters.description: A ServiceController object to stop.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the service.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Return the System.ServiceProcess.ServiceController service object.

parameters.name: PendingStatusWait
parameters.description: The amount of time to wait for a service to get out of a pending state before continuing. Default is 60 seconds.

parameters.name: SkipDependentServices
parameters.description: Choose to skip checking for and stopping dependent services.

name: Test-ADTBattery
synopsis: Tests whether the local machine is running on AC power or not.
description: Tests whether the local machine is running on AC power and returns true/false. For detailed information, use the -PassThru option to get a hashtable containing various battery and power status properties.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Outputs an object containing the following properties: - ACPowerLineStatus - BatteryChargeStatus - BatteryLifePercent - BatterySaverEnabled - BatteryLifeRemaining - BatteryFullLifetime - IsUsingACPower - IsLaptop

name: Test-ADTCallerIsAdmin
synopsis: Checks if the current user has administrative privileges.
description: This function checks if the current user is a member of the Administrators group. It returns a boolean value indicating whether the user has administrative privileges.

name: Test-ADTEspActive
synopsis: Checks if the device is currently within a device or user Enrollment Status Page (ESP) phase.
description: This function checks if the device is currently within a device or user Enrollment Status Page (ESP) phase.

name: Test-ADTMicrophoneInUse
synopsis: Tests whether the device's microphone is in use.
description: Tests whether someone is using the microphone on their device. This could be within Teams, Zoom, a game, or any other app that uses a microphone.

name: Test-ADTModuleInitialized
synopsis: Checks if the ADT (PSAppDeployToolkit) module is initialized.
description: This function checks if the ADT (PSAppDeployToolkit) module is initialized by retrieving the module data and returning the initialization status.

name: Test-ADTMSUpdates
synopsis: Test whether a Microsoft Windows update is installed.
description: This function checks if a specified Microsoft Windows update, identified by its KB number, is installed on the local machine. It first attempts to find the update using the Get-HotFix cmdlet and, if unsuccessful, uses a COM object to search the update history.

parameters.name: KbNumber
parameters.description: KBNumber of the update.

name: Test-ADTMutexAvailability
synopsis: Wait, up to a timeout value, to check if current thread is able to acquire an exclusive lock on a system mutex.
description: A mutex can be used to serialize applications and prevent multiple instances from being opened at the same time. Wait, up to a timeout (default is 1 millisecond), for the mutex to become available for an exclusive lock.

parameters.name: MutexName
parameters.description: The name of the system mutex.

parameters.name: MutexWaitTime
parameters.description: The number of milliseconds the current thread should wait to acquire an exclusive lock of a named mutex. A wait time of -1 milliseconds means to wait indefinitely. A wait time of zero does not acquire an exclusive lock but instead tests the state of the wait handle and returns immediately.

name: Test-ADTNetworkConnection
synopsis: Tests for an active local network connection, excluding wireless and virtual network adapters.
description: Tests for an active local network connection, excluding wireless and virtual network adapters, by querying the Win32_NetworkAdapter WMI class. This function checks if any physical network adapter is in the 'Up' status.

name: Test-ADTOobeCompleted
synopsis: Checks if the device's Out-of-Box Experience (OOBE) has completed or not.
description: This function checks if the current device has completed the Out-of-Box Experience (OOBE).

name: Test-ADTPowerPoint
synopsis: Tests whether PowerPoint is running in either fullscreen slideshow mode or presentation mode.
description: Tests whether someone is presenting using PowerPoint in either fullscreen slideshow mode or presentation mode. This function checks if the PowerPoint process has a window with a title that begins with "PowerPoint Slide Show" or "PowerPoint-" for non-English language systems. There is a possibility of a false positive if the PowerPoint filename starts with "PowerPoint Slide Show". If the previous detection method does not detect PowerPoint in fullscreen mode, it checks if PowerPoint is in Presentation Mode (only works on Windows Vista or higher).

name: Test-ADTRegistryValue
synopsis: Test if a registry value exists.
description: Checks a registry key path to see if it has a value with a given name. Can correctly handle cases where a value simply has an empty or null value.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: Path of the registry key.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the value to check the existence of.

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: The security identifier (SID) for a user. Specifying this parameter will convert a HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry key to the HKEY_USERS\$SID format. Specify this parameter from the Invoke-ADTAllUsersRegistryAction function to read/edit HKCU registry settings for all users on the system.

parameters.name: Wow6432Node
parameters.description: Specify this switch to check the 32-bit registry (Wow6432Node) on 64-bit systems.

name: Test-ADTServiceExists
synopsis: Check to see if a service exists.
description: Check to see if a service exists. The UseCIM switch can be used in conjunction with PassThru to return WMI objects for PSADT v3.x compatibility, however, this method fails in Windows Sandbox.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the service. Note: Service name can be found by executing "Get-Service | Format-Table -AutoSize -Wrap" or by using the properties screen of a service in services.msc.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Return the WMI service object. To see all the properties use: Test-ADTServiceExists -Name 'spooler' -PassThru | Get-Member

parameters.name: UseCIM
parameters.description: Use CIM/WMI to check for the service. This is useful for compatibility with PSADT v3.x.

name: Test-ADTSessionActive
synopsis: Checks if there is an active ADT session.
description: This function checks if there is an active ADT (App Deploy Toolkit) session by retrieving the module data and returning the count of active sessions.

name: Test-ADTUserIsBusy
synopsis: Tests whether the device's microphone is in use, the user has manually turned on presentation mode, or PowerPoint is running in either fullscreen slideshow mode or presentation mode.
description: Tests whether the device's microphone is in use, the user has manually turned on presentation mode, or PowerPoint is running in either fullscreen slideshow mode or presentation mode.

name: Unblock-ADTAppExecution
synopsis: Unblocks the execution of applications performed by the Block-ADTAppExecution function.
description: This function is called by the Close-ADTSession function. It undoes the actions performed by Block-ADTAppExecution, allowing previously blocked applications to execute.

parameters.name: Tasks
parameters.description: Specify the scheduled tasks to unblock.

name: Uninstall-ADTApplication
synopsis: Removes one or more applications specified by name, filter script, or InstalledApplication object from Get-ADTApplication.
description: Removes one or more applications specified by name, filter script, or InstalledApplication object from Get-ADTApplication. Enumerates the registry for installed applications via Get-ADTApplication, matching the specified application name and uninstalls that application using its uninstall string, with the ability to specify additional uninstall parameters also.

parameters.name: AdditionalArgumentList
parameters.description: Adds to the default parameters specified in the config.psd1 file, or the parameters found in QuietUninstallString/UninstallString for EXE applications.

parameters.name: ApplicationType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of application to remove. Valid values are 'All', 'MSI', and 'EXE'. The default value is 'All'.

parameters.name: ArgumentList
parameters.description: Overrides the default MSI parameters specified in the config.psd1 file, or the parameters found in QuietUninstallString/UninstallString for EXE applications.

parameters.name: ExitOnProcessFailure
parameters.description: Automatically closes the active deployment session via Close-ADTSession in the event the process exits with a non-success or non-ignored exit code.

parameters.name: FilterScript
parameters.description: A script used to filter the results as they're processed.

parameters.name: IgnoreExitCodes
parameters.description: List the exit codes to ignore or * to ignore all exit codes. Where possible, please use `-SuccessExitCodes` and/or `-RebootExitCodes` instead.

parameters.name: IncludeUpdatesAndHotfixes
parameters.description: Include matches against updates and hotfixes in results.

parameters.name: InstalledApplication
parameters.description: Specifies the [PSADT.Types.InstalledApplication] object to remove. This parameter is typically used when piping Get-ADTApplication to this function.

parameters.name: KillChildProcessesWithParent
parameters.description: Specifies whether any child processes started by the provided executable should be closed when the provided executable closes. This is handy for application installs that open web browsers and other programs that cannot be suppressed.

parameters.name: LogFileName
parameters.description: Overrides the default log file name for MSI applications. The default log file name is generated from the MSI file name. If LogFileName does not end in .log, it will be automatically appended. For uninstallations, by default the product code is resolved to the DisplayName and version of the application.

parameters.name: LoggingOptions
parameters.description: Overrides the default MSI logging options specified in the config.psd1 file. Default options are: "/L*v".

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the application to retrieve information for. Performs a contains match on the application display name by default.

parameters.name: NameMatch
parameters.description: Specifies the type of match to perform on the application name. Valid values are 'Contains', 'Exact', 'Wildcard', and 'Regex'. The default value is 'Contains'.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Returns a PSADT.Types.ProcessResult object, providing the ExitCode, StdOut, and StdErr output from the uninstallation.

parameters.name: ProductCode
parameters.description: The product code of the application to retrieve information for.

parameters.name: RebootExitCodes
parameters.description: List of exit codes to indicate a reboot is required. Defaults to values set during ADTSession initialization, otherwise: 1641, 3010

parameters.name: SecureArgumentList
parameters.description: Hides all parameters passed to the executable from the Toolkit log file.

parameters.name: SuccessExitCodes
parameters.description: List of exit codes to be considered successful. Defaults to values set during ADTSession initialization, otherwise: 0

parameters.name: WaitForChildProcesses
parameters.description: Specifies whether the started process should be considered finished only when any child processes it spawns have finished also.

name: Unregister-ADTDll
synopsis: Unregister a DLL file.
description: Unregister a DLL file using regsvr32.exe. This function takes the path to the DLL file and attempts to unregister it using the regsvr32.exe utility.

parameters.name: FilePath
parameters.description: Path to the DLL file.

name: Update-ADTDesktop
synopsis: Refresh the Windows Explorer Shell, which causes the desktop icons and the environment variables to be reloaded.
description: This function refreshes the Windows Explorer Shell, causing the desktop icons and environment variables to be reloaded. This can be useful after making changes that affect the desktop or environment variables, ensuring that the changes are reflected immediately.

name: Update-ADTEnvironmentPsProvider
synopsis: Updates the environment variables for the current PowerShell session with any environment variable changes that may have occurred during script execution.
description: Environment variable changes that take place during script execution are not visible to the current PowerShell session. Use this function to refresh the current PowerShell session with all environment variable settings.

parameters.name: LoadLoggedOnUserEnvironmentVariables
parameters.description: If script is running in SYSTEM context, this option allows loading environment variables from the active console user. If no console user exists but users are logged in, such as on terminal servers, then the first logged-in non-console user.

name: Update-ADTGroupPolicy
synopsis: Performs a gpupdate command to refresh Group Policies on the local machine.
description: This function performs a gpupdate command to refresh Group Policies on the local machine. It updates both Computer and User policies by forcing a refresh using the gpupdate.exe utility.

name: Write-ADTLogEntry
synopsis: Write messages to a log file in CMTrace.exe compatible format or Legacy text file format.
description: Write messages to a log file in CMTrace.exe compatible format or Legacy text file format and optionally display in the console. This function supports different severity levels and can be used to log debug messages if required.

parameters.name: DebugMessage
parameters.description: Specifies that the message is a debug message. Debug messages only get logged if -LogDebugMessage is set to $true.

parameters.name: HostLogStream
parameters.description: Controls how the log entry is written to the console window.

parameters.name: LogFileDirectory
parameters.description: Set the directory where the log file will be saved.

parameters.name: LogFileName
parameters.description: Set the name of the log file.

parameters.name: LogType
parameters.description: Choose whether to write a CMTrace.exe compatible log file or a Legacy text log file.

parameters.name: Message
parameters.description: The message to write to the log file or output to the console.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Return the message that was passed to the function.

parameters.name: ScriptSection
parameters.description: The heading for the portion of the script that is being executed.

parameters.name: Severity
parameters.description: Defines message type. When writing to console or CMTrace.exe log format, it allows highlighting of message type.

parameters.name: Source
parameters.description: The source of the message being logged.
